ssw: icsir yacala kwakha lecpap ngemuva kwekutsi umhlaba ucale kubukana nekuswelakala lokukhulu kwetisitakuphefumula.

eng: "around march and april, there suddenly became a short supply of ventilators from our international suppliers.
ssw: "kusukela ngendlovulenkhulu kanye namabasa, kwaba nekuswelakala ngekushesha kwekuphakelwa ngetisitakuphefumula kubatfulitinsita betfu bemave emhlaba.

eng: where you could get them, they were very expensive so government issued a tender for the production of ventilators," says sanne.
ssw: lapho betitfolakala khona, besetibita kakhulu ngaleso sizatfuke, hulumende wakhipha ithenda kutsi kukhicitwe letisitakuphefumula," kusho yena njalo sanne.

eng: the tender was part of the government’s national ventilator project within the department of trade, industry and competition.
ssw: lethenda beyiyincenye yemklamo wavelonkhe wetisitakuphefumula wahulumende kulitiko letekuhwebelana, timboni nekuchudzelana.

eng: the csir is also working on a bilevel positive airway pressure ventilator aimed at helping patients with more severe symptoms of covid19.
ssw: icsir isasematasatasa futsi ngekukhicita sisitakuphefumula ibilevel positive airway pressure lokuhloswe ngaso kusita tigulane letinetimphawu letimbi kakhulu tecovid19.

eng: help stop the spread of covid19 vukuzenzele unnamed our nation is con fronted by the gravest crisis in the history of our democracy.
ssw: sita kutsi sivimbe kubhebhetseka kwecovid19 vukuzenzele unnamed sive sakitsi sibukene nenkinga lenkhulukati emlandvweni wetfu wentsandvo yelinyenti.

eng: for more than 120 days, we have succeeded in delaying the spread of a virus that is causing devastation across the globe.
ssw: ngetulu kwetinsuku leti120, siphumelele kubambelela kubhebhetseka kweligciwane lelibanga umonakalo lomkhulukati emhlabeni wonkhana.

eng: but now, the surge in infections that we had been advised by our medical experts would come, has arrived.
ssw: kodvwa nyalo, kwandza kakhulu kwekusuleleka leselulekwe ngako tati tetekwelapha kutsi kuyeta, sekufikile.

eng: more than a quarter of a million south africans have been infected with coronavirus, and we know that many more infections have gone undetected.
ssw: bangetulu kwekota yesigidzi bantfu baseningizimu afrika lasebasuleleke ngaleligciwane lecorona, siyati futsi kutsi kwesuleleka lokunyenti kusengakabonwa.

eng: we are now recording over 12,000 new cases every day.
ssw: nyalo sesitfola tehlakalo tekwesuleleka letinsha letingetulu kwe12,000 malanga onkhe.

eng: since the start of the outbreak in march, at least 4,079 people have died from covid19.
ssw: kusukela kwacala lokubhedvuka ngenyanga yendlovulenkhulu, lokungenani sekushone bantfu laba4, 079 ngenca yalecovid19.

eng: like the massive cold fronts that sweep into our country from the south atlantic at this time of year, there are few parts of the country that will remain untouched by the coronavirus.
ssw: njengaloku kunemakhata lashubisa umnkantja lahlasele lelive lakitsi lachamuka eningizimu yeatlantic ngalesikhatsi semnyaka, timbalwa tincenye talelive letingeke titsintfwe nguleligciwane lecorona.

eng: the coronavirus storm is far fiercer and more destructive than any we have known before.
ssw: lesivunguvungu saleligciwane lecorona sinelulaka lolukhulu futsi sibhubhisa kakhulu kwengca nome ngabe yini lesikwatiko kwaphambilini.

eng: it is stretching our resources and our resolve to their limits.
ssw: imitfombolusito yetfu isebenta ngalokwecile futsi seyisondzele emikhawulweni yayo.

eng: the surge of infections that our experts and scientists predicted over 3 months ago has now arrived.
ssw: lokwandza kwekwesuleleka tingcweti tetfu tetekwelapha kanye nabososayensi labakubiketele etinyangeni letintsatfu letengcile nyalo sekufikile.

eng: it started in the western cape and is now underway in the eastern cape and gauteng.
ssw: kucale enshonalanga kapa kantsi futsi sekusendleleni kuya emphumalanga kapa nasegauteng.

eng: yet, while infections rise exponentially, it is important to note that our case fatality rate of 1.5 percent is among the lowest in the world.
ssw: nanome kunjalo, ngesikhatsi kusuleleka kwandza kakhulu, kubalulekile kucaphela kutsi lizinga lemaphesenti la1.5 alabo labashonako lisemkhatsini walaphasi kakhulu emhlabeni.

eng: this is compared to a global average case fatality rate of 4.4 percent.
ssw: loku kucatsaniswa neavareji yemhlaba wonkhe yemaphesenti la4.4 elizinga lalabashonako.

eng: we owe the relatively low number of deaths in our country to the experience and dedication of our health professionals and the urgent measures we have taken to build the capacity of our health system.
ssw: lelinani lelincane lalabashonako kulelive kungenca yesipiliyoni kanye nekutinikela kwetingcweti tetfu tetemphilo kanye netinyatselo letiphutfumako lesititsetse sakha emandla ekwenta umsebenti eluhlelweni lwetfu lwetemphilo.

eng: even as most of our people have taken action to prevent the spread of the virus, there are others who have not.
ssw: njengaloku linyenti lebantfu bakitsi batsatse sinyatselo sekuvikela kubhebhetseka kwaleligciwane, kodvwa kukhona labanye labangakwenti loko.

eng: there are some among us who ignore the regulations that have been passed to combat the disease.
ssw: kukhona labanye emkhatsini wetfu labangayishayi mkhuba lemitsetfomgomo leshayiwe yekulwa nalesifo.

eng: in the midst of such a pandemic, getting into a taxi without a face mask, gathering to meet friends, attending parties or even visiting family, can too easily spread the virus and cost lives.
ssw: kusekhona lolubhubhane, kugibela eteksini ungakafaki sifonyo, kuhlangana nebangani, kuhambela imicimbi yemadzili nome ngisho nekuvakashela umndeni, kungabhebhetsekisa leligciwane kalula futsi kube khona labalahlekelwa timphilo tabo.

eng: this may be a disease that is caused by a virus, but it is spread by human conduct and behaviour.
ssw: lesi kungaba sifo lesibangwa ligciwane kodvwa libhebhetsekiswa kutiphatsa kwemuntfu.

eng: through our own actions – as individuals, as families, as communities – we can and we must change the course of this pandemic in our country.
ssw: ngenca yetento tetfu – talowo nalowo, temindeni, temimango, – singakhona futsi kufanele kutsi siyigucule indlela yalolubhubhane kulelive lakitsi.

eng: we need to wear a cloth mask that covers our nose and mouth whenever we leave home.
ssw: kudzingeka kutsi sifake sifonyo sendvwangu lesivala imphumulo nemlomo nangabe siphuma ekhaya.

eng: we must continue to regularly wash our hands with soap and water or sanitiser.
ssw: kufanele kutsi sichubeke sigeze njalo tandla tetfu ngensipho nemanti nome ngesibulalimagciwane.

eng: we must continue to clean and sanitise all surfaces in all public spaces.
ssw: kufanele kutsi sichubeke sigeze futsi sihlante ngesibulalimagciwane lonkhe lingetulu letindzawo lapho kutfolakala khona bantfu.

eng: most importantly, we must keep a safe distance – of at least 2 metres – from other people.
ssw: lokubaluleke kakhulu, kufanele kutsi sishiye libanga lekukhweshelana leliphephile – lokungenani lemamitha lamabili – kulomunye umuntfu.

eng: there is now emerging evidence that the virus may also be carried in tiny particles in the air in places that are crowded, closed or have poor air circulation.
ssw: nyalo sekunebufakazi lobusha lobuvelako bekutsi leligciwane lingahlala emoyeni etindzaweni lapho kunesicuku sebantfu, letivalekile nome letingangenisi kahle umoya.

eng: for this reason we must immediately improve the indoor environment of public places where the risk of infection is greatest.
ssw: ngaleso sizatfuke kufanele kutsi sitente ncono timondzawo letingekhatsi tetindzawo temmango lapho bungoti bekusuleleka ngalesifo bubukhulu kakhulu.

eng: our decision to declare a nationwide lockdown prevented a massive early surge of infections when our health services were less prepared, which would have resulted in a far greater loss of lives.
ssw: sincumo setfu sekumemetela kumiswansi kwemisebenti, iminyakato nekuhlala ekhaya kwavelonkhe kwavimbela kusuleleka lokukhulu ekucaleni ngesikhatsi tinsita tetfu tetemphilo betisengakalungeli kahle, lokuyintfo lengabe yaholela ekulahlekelweni kakhulu timphilo tebantfu.

eng: in the time that we had, we have taken important measures to strengthen our health response.
ssw: kulesikhatsi lesibe naso, sitsatse tinyatselo letimcoka tekucinisa kuphendvula kwetfu ngekwetemphilo.

eng: we have conducted more than two million coronavirus tests and community health workers have done more than 20 million screenings.
ssw: sesente luhlolo lweligciwane lecorona lolungetulu kwetigidzi letimbili kantsi tisebenti temmango tetemphilo setente luhlolokuhlunga lolungetulu kwetigidzi letinge20.

eng: we have made available almost 28,000 hospital beds for covid19 patients and have constructed functional field hospitals across the country.
ssw: sesente kutsi kube nemibhedze yasesibhedlela yelinani lelifinyelela ku28,000 yetigulane tecovid19 futsi sesakhe netibhedlela tesikhashana letisebentako eveni lonkhe.

eng: we now have over 37,000 quarantine beds in private and public facilities across the country, ready to isolate those who cannot do so at home.
ssw: nyalo sesinemibhedze yekuhlala wedvwa ngenca yesifo lengetulu kwe37,000 kutisetjentiswa letitimele kanye nakutisetjentiswa tahulumende eveni lonkhe, letilungele kwehlukanisa ngayedvwa labo labangakhoni kukwenta nabasemakhaya.

eng: we have procured and delivered millions of items of personal protective equipment to hospitals, clinics and schools across the country to protect our frontline workers.
ssw: sesitsenge saphindza futsi saletsa tisetjentiswa tekutivikela etibhedlela, emitfolamphilo kanye nasetikolweni kulolonkhe lelive kute kutsi sivikele tisebenti tetfu tetemphilo letisembili lapho imphi ishisa khona.

eng: we have recruited and continue to recruit additional nurses, doctors and emergency health personnel.
ssw: siphindze futsi satweba futsi siyachubeka nekutweba bahlengi/bahlengikati labangetiwe, bodokotela kanye netisebenti tetemphilo tesimo lesiphutfumako.

eng: we continue to make progress in our efforts to deal with covid 19, but our greatest challenge still lies ahead.
ssw: siyachubeka nekwenta inchubekelembili emitameni yetfu yekubukana nalecovid19, kodvwa insayeya yetfu lenkhulu iseta.

eng: across all provinces, we are working to further increase the number of general ward and critical beds available for covid19 patients.
ssw: kuto tonkhe tifundza, sisebenta ngemandla kutsi sandzise linani lemawadijikelele kanye nemibhedze yesimo lesibucayi yetigulane te covid19 kutsi ibekhona.

eng: ward capacity is being freed up in a number of hospitals by delaying nonurgent care, the conversion of some areas of hospitals into additional ward space and the erection or expansion of field hospitals.
ssw: umtsamo wemawadi uyandziswa etibhedlela letinengi ngekutsi kubanjelelwe kunakekelwa kwetimo letingaphutfumi, kuguculwa kwaletinye tindzawo etibhedlela kutsi tibe ngemawadi langetiwe kanye nekwakhiwa nekukhuliswa kwetibhedlela tesikhashana.

eng: we are working to increase supplies of oxygen, ventilators and other equipment for those who will need critical care, including by diverting the supply of oxygen from other purposes.
ssw: siyasebenta kute kutsi sandzise kuphakelwa kwemoyamphilo, tisitakuphefumula kanye naletinye tisetjentiswa kulabo labatawudzinga kunakekelwa lokubucayi, lokufaka ekhatsi kujikiswa kuphakelwa kwemoyamphilo kuletinye tinhloso.

eng: we are deploying digital technologies to strengthen the identification, tracing and isolation of contacts, and to provide support to those who test positive.
ssw: sisabalalisa tebuchwepheshe bedijithali kute sicinise kubona, kulandzelela kanye nekwehlukanisa kutsi bahlale bodvwa labo labatsintsene nalabesulelekile, kanye nekwesekela labo labahlolwe bakhatfolakala kutsi banaleligciwane.

eng: as we now approach the peak of infections, we need to take extra precautions and tighten existing measures to slow down the rate of transmission.
ssw: njengaloku nyalo sesifinyelela ngasezingeni lelisetulu lekusuleleka, sidzinga kutsi sicaphele kakhulu futsi sicinise letinyatselo letikhona kute sehlise lizinga lekundluliseleka kwalesifo.

eng: regulations on the wearing of masks will be strengthened.
ssw: imitsetfomgomo yekufaka tifonyo itawuciniswa.

eng: employers, shop owners and managers, public transport operators, and managers and owners of any other public building are now legally obliged to ensure that anyone entering their premises or vehicle must be wearing a mask.
ssw: tisebenti, banikati betitolo kanye nebaphatsi, labasebentisa tekutfutsa ummango, kanye nebalawuli kanye nebanikati banome ngabe ngusiphi sakhiwo semmango nyalo sebacindzetelwa ngumtsetfo kutsi bacinisekise kutsi nome ngabe ngubani longena emabaleni ato nome logibela sigitjelwa kufanele kutsi afake sifonyo.

eng: taxis undertaking local trips will now be permitted to increase their capacity to 100 percent, while long distance taxis will not be allowed to exceed 70 percent occupancy, on condition that new risk mitigation protocols related to masks, vehicle sanitising and open windows are followed.
ssw: ematekisi lahamba luhambo lwendzawo avumelekile kutsi alayishe umtsamo wemaphesenti la100 kantsi lawo lahamba emabanga lamadze ngeke avunyelwe kutsi engce umtsamo wemaphesenti lange70, ngaphasi kwesimo sekutsi sendlelanchubo yekunciphisa bungoti lobusha lobuphatselene netifonyo, kufutsa sigitjelwa ngesibulalimagciwane kanye nekuvulwa kwemafasitelo tiyalandzelwa.

eng: there is now clear evidence that the resumption of alcohol sales has resulted in substantial pressure being put on hospitals, including trauma and icu units, due to motor vehicle accidents, violence and related trauma.
ssw: nyalo sekukhona bufakazi lobucacile bekutsi kucala futsi kwekutsengiswa kwetjwala kube nemphumela nekucindzeteleka lokukhulu kwetibhedlela, lokufaka ekhatsi emayunithi ekunakekela timo letibucayi tetingoti nemaicu, ngenca yetingoti tetimoto, budlova kanye netingoti letiphatselene naloko.

eng: we have therefore decided that in order to conserve hospital capacity, the sale, dispensing and distribution of alcohol will be suspended with immediate effect.
ssw: ngenca yalokoke sesincume kutsi kute songe umtsamo wetibhedlela, kutsengiswa, kusatjalaliswa kwetjwala kutawumiswa ngekushesha.

eng: as an additional measure to reduce the pressure on hospitals, a curfew will be put in place between the hours of 9pm and 4am.
ssw: njengesinyatselo lesengetiwe sekunciphisa kucindzeteleka kwetibhedlela, kutawubekwa sikhatsi lesingumncamulajucu wekungatfolakali ngaphandle emkhatsini wensimbi ye9:00 ebusuku nensimbi ye4:00 ekuseni.

eng: we are taking these measures fully aware that they impose unwelcome restrictions on people’s lives.
ssw: sitsatsa letinyatselo ngekwati kahle kamhlophe kutsi titawuletsa kuvimbeleka lokungemukeleki etimphilweni tebantfu bakitsi.

eng: they are, however, necessary to see us through the peak of the disease.
ssw: nanome kunjalo, tidzingekile kute siphumelele kuncoba kulelizinga lelisetulu lekutseleleka ngalesifo.

eng: there is no way that we can avoid the coronavirus storm.
ssw: kute lenye indlela yekugwema lesivunguvungu seligciwane lecorona.

eng: but we can limit the damage that it can cause to our lives.
ssw: kodvwa singakhona kutsi sinciphise umonakalo lelingawubanga etimphilweni tetfu.

eng: as a nation we have come together to support each other, to provide comfort to those who are ill and to promote acceptance of people living with the virus.
ssw: sisive sihlangene sonkhe kutsi sisekelane, sidvudvute labo labagulako kanye nekugcugcutela kutsi kube nekwemukeleka kulabo labaphila naleligciwane.

eng: now, more than ever, we are responsible for the lives of those around us.
ssw: nyalo, kakhulu kunakucala, sinesibopho ngetimphilo talabo lesiphila nabo.

eng: crew juliet firefighter shares her story dale hes young firefighter vuyiseka arendse (26) is part of crew juliet, south africa’s first allfemale wildland firefighting team.
ssw: umcimimlilo wecrew juliet usitekela indzaba yakhe dale hes bomake kufanele kutsi bavule indlela ehlane, kusho umcimimlilo.

eng: her strength and determination to make a name for herself in the maledominated world of firefighting is a true inspiration to all women.
ssw: umcimimlilo lomncane vuyiseka arendse (26) uyincenye yelicembu lecrew juliet, licembu laseningizimu afrika lekucala lebacimimlilo wetikhotsa labomake kuphela.

eng: arendse grew up in the small western cape town of beaufort west.
ssw: arendse wakhulela edolobheni lelincane lasebhofolo lelisenshonalanga kapa.

eng: after school, she tried studying at a college in oudtshoorn, but decided to move back home to support her family.
ssw: emva kwekucedza sikolo, walinga kufundza ekolishi eoudtshoorn, kodvwa wancuma kubuyela emuva ekhaya kuyokondla umndeni wakhe.

eng: she worked at a supermarket for a while, but then firefighting caught her eye.
ssw: wasebenta esuphamakethe kwesikhashana, kodvwa kucima umlilo kwatsatsa emehlo akhe.

eng: "i saw the firefighters in their uniforms and the big red trucks.
ssw: "ngabona bacimimlilo bagcoke iyunifomu yabo kanye nemaloli labovu lamakhulu.

eng: i immediately became interested and wanted to find out more," says arendse.
ssw: ngatsatseka ngekushesha ngase ngifuna kwati kabanti," kusho arendse.

eng: arendse was one of the graduates of the western cape government’s chrysalis academy youth development programme in 2016. after the programme, she worked at the fire station in beaufort west, earning only r1 900 per month.
ssw: arendse bekangulomunye walabaphotfula batfweswa ticu echrysalis academy yahulumende wasenshonalanga kapa yeluhlelo lwekutfutfukisa lusha nga2016.

eng: but then she came across an opportunity offered by ncc environmental services last year.
ssw: kodvwa wabese utfola litfuba lalinikwa luphiko lwetemvelo lwencc kulomnyaka lophelile.

eng: "i was at chrysalis academy as a facilitator when ncc came to talk to the students about the opportunity to apply for training for the first allfemale wildland firefighting team.
ssw: "bengisechrysalis academy njengemchubinchubo ngesikhatsi bakancc bafika batewukhuluma nebafundzi mayelana nelitfuba lekufaka ticelo tekuceceshwa kwelicembu lebacimimlilo wetikhotsa lekucala labomake kuphela.

eng: even though i was not one of the students, i was very interested and applied for the training, and i was accepted," arendse says.
ssw: nanome bengingasuye lomunye webafundzi, ngatsatseka kakhulu ngafaka sicelo sekutsi ngiceceshwe, futsi bangemukela," kusho yena njalo arendse.

eng: arendse went through the training, which combined theory and practical aspects of firefighting.
ssw: arendse waceceshwa, ngalokuhlanganisa lwatimcondvo kanye netinhlangotsi talokwentiwa ngetandla mbamba tekucima umlilo.

eng: "i learnt so much.
ssw: "ngafundza lokunyenti.

eng: for one, i didn’t know that there were firefighters tasked with putting out wildfires.
ssw: lokunye kutsi, bengingati kutsi kunebacimimlilo labasebenta kucima imililo yetikhotsa.

eng: i had previously thought they only worked in towns to put out fires in buildings," she says.
ssw: phambilini bengicabanga kutsi, basebenta kuphela emadolobheni kucisha imililo yasetakhiweni," kusho yena.

eng: arendse adds that it was an amazing feeling to pass the training and become part of the first allfemale firefighting team of its kind.
ssw: arendse wengeta ngekutsi wativela bumnandzi lobumangalisako kuphumelela kulokuceceshwa nekutsi futsi abe yincenye yelicembu lekucala labomake kuphela lebacimimlilo baloluhlobo.

eng: "i felt very excited, especially because when i had told people i wanted to be a firefighter, many of them said i could not do it because i am a woman and would not cope with the job.
ssw: "ngativa ngijabule kakhulu, ikakhulu ngatsi nangitjela bantfu kutsi ngifuna kuba ngumcimimlilo, labanengi bangitjela kutsi ngeke ngikhone kukwenta loko ngobe ngingumuntfu longumake futsi ngeke ngikhone kumelana nalowo msebenti.

eng: this pushed me to show them that i can actually do it, not only for myself but for the rest of the women in south africa.
ssw: loko kwangigcugcutela kutsi ngitimisele ngobe ngifuna kubakhomba kutsi kahlehle ngingakhona kuwenta lomsebenti, futsi hhayi kutentela mine kodvwa ngentele bonkhe bomake baseningizimu afrika.

eng: "arendse says that fighting her first major fire in noordhoek was a challenging but highly rewarding experience.
ssw: "arendse utsi kucima kwakhe umlilo lomkhulu kwekucala enoordhoek kwaba yinsayeya kodvwa kwamnika sipiliyoni lazuza lokukhulu ngaso.

eng: "it was my first full 24hour shift and the first time we were working with all the other male firefighters.
ssw: "bekukadze kulitfuba lami lekucala lekusebenta emaawa lange24 lagcwele futsi kukwekucala kusebenta nalabanye bacimimlilo labadvuna.

eng: it was tiring and very hot in our protective gear but we finished the job and the feeling afterwards was very rewarding.
ssw: bekudzinisana futsi kushisa kakhulu kuletembatfo tetfu tekusivikela kodvwa sawuphotfula lowo msebenti noko lesakuva emva kwaloko kwaba yinzuzo lenkhulu emoyeni wetfu.

eng: "arendse encourages the women of south africa to never underestimate themselves.
ssw: "arendse ugcugcutela bomake baseningizimu afrika kutsi bangatikhobosi.

eng: "don’t be defined by what people say you can and can’t do."
ssw: "ungavumi kuchazwa bantfu ngaloko bantfu labatsi ungakwenta naloko futsi labatsi angeke ukwente."

eng: celebrating women through economic inclusion vukuzenzele unnamed in august south africa celebrates women’s month.
ssw: kubungata bomake ngekubafaka kubungata bomake ngekubafaka kutemnotfokutemnotfo vukuzenzele unnamed ngenyanga yengci iningizimu afrika igubha inyanga yabomake.

eng: this occasion marks the anniversary of the day in 1956 when 20,000 women marched to the union buildings – a great sea of womankind speaking many languages, from different places and of all races.
ssw: lesikhatsi sekugubha lusuku lwekukhumbula nga1956 ngesikhatsi bomake laba20 000 bashuca baya eunion buildings – sicuku lesikhulu sabomake lebe sikhuluma tilwimi letinengi, labe bavela etindzaweni letahlukene futsi bato tonkhe tinhlanga.

eng: they were united in their demand for an end to the dreaded pass laws and for their right to live in freedom.
ssw: bebabumbene bayintfo yinye kuloko bebakufuna kutsi kupheliswe imitsetfo lemibi yemapasi kanye nelilungelo labo lekuphila ngenkhululeko.

eng: the status and position of women in south africa today is vastly different to that faced by our mothers and grandmothers in 1956. we have come a long way in realising a south africa that is nonracial, nonsexist, democratic, prosperous and free.
ssw: simo sabomake kanye nesikhundla sabo lapha eningizimuafrika lamuhla sesigucuke kakhulu kunaleso bomake betfu kanye nabogogo betfu labebabukene naso nga1956.

eng: there has been real progress in improving the lives of south african women in the economy, in the political sphere and in public life.
ssw: sesihambe libanga lelidze ekwenteni iningizimu afrika lengahlukanisi sive ngebuhlanga, ngebulili, yentsandvo yelinyenti, lephumelelako futsi nalekhululekile.

eng: at the same time, we know there is so much further we still have to go.
ssw: ngalokufananako, siyati kutsi kusasekunengi kakhulu lesingachubeka sikwente.

eng: women still face discrimination, harassment and violence, and bear the greatest brunt of poverty.
ssw: bomake solo basabukene nekubandlululwa, kugcagcalatiswa nebudlova, futsi ngibo labatsintfwa kakhulu buphuya.

eng: if we are to truly realise the promise of our constitution we have to tackle the economic and financial exclusion that makes women more vulnerable to abuse and violence.
ssw: nangabe sitawufezekisa ngeliciniso setsembiso semtsetfosisekelo wetfu, kufanele kutsi silungise kukhishelwa ngephandle kutemnotfo kanye nakutetimali kwabomake lokuyintfo leyenta bomake kutsi bahlaseleke lula nabahlukunyetwa kanye nebudlova.

eng: we have joined a groundbreaking campaign that links us to global efforts to achieve gender equality by 2030. generation equality is an ambitious and transformative agenda to end discrimination and violence against women and for their equal participation in political, social and economic life.
ssw: sesijoyine umkhankhaso loyinchophamlandvo losichumanisa nemitamo yemhlaba wonkhe yekufezekisa kulingana ngebulili nga2030.

eng: as part of this campaign, we have joined two ‘action coalitions’, one for economic justice and rights and another against genderbased violence.
ssw: kulingana kwesitukulwane luhlelo lolunekulangatelela kwenta lokukhulu futsi loluguculako lwekucedza kubandlululwa kanye nebudlova lobucondzi swe kubomake kanye nekutimbandzakanya kwabo ngalokulinganako kutepolitiki, kutenhlalo nasemphilweni yetemnotfo.

eng: both of these themes are critical to our own national agenda.
ssw: totimbili letingcikitsi timcoka vele kuluhlelo lwetfu lwavelonkhe.

eng: eleven months since the emergency response action plan to combat genderbased violence and femicide was implemented we have made progress in expanding support and care to survivors, and progress is being made in legal reforms to afford them greater protection.
ssw: tinyanga leti11 kusukela lisu lekwenta kuphendvula simo lesiphutfumako lekulwa nebudlova lobeyamene nebulili kanye nekubulawa kwabomake lafezekiswa sesibe nenchubekelembili ekungeteni kusekela nekunakekela labo labahlukumetekile, futsi kunenchubekelembili leseyentiwe ekuguculeni temtsetfo kutsi bavikeleke kakhulu.

eng: during the month of august, we begin the implementation of the national strategic plan to combat genderbased violence and femicide.
ssw: ngesikhatsi senyanga yengci, sicala ngekufezekisa lisu lavelonkhe lesibuciko lekulwa nebudlova lobeyamene nebulili kanye nekubulawa kwabomake.

eng: a key aspect of the plan is on ensuring greater women’s financial inclusion.
ssw: luhlangotsi lolumcoka kakhulu kulelisu lumayelana nekucinisekisa kufaka kakhulu bomake kutetimali.

eng: this is because economic inequality and social inequality are interconnected.
ssw: loku kungenca yekutsi kungalingani ngekwetemnotfo kanye nekung alingani ngekwetenhlalo kuhlangene.

eng: the economic status of women in south africa makes them more vulnerable to abuse.
ssw: simo setemnotfo sabomake lapha eningizimu afrika sibenta kutsi bahlaseleke lula nabahlukunyetwa.

eng: we must therefore scale up support for women to enable them to become financially independent.
ssw: kufaneleke kutsi senyuse kwesekela kwetfu bomake kute kutsi bakhone kutimela ngekwetetimali.

eng: we have made a number of commitments under generation equality that will be given effect to through the national strategic plan.
ssw: sesente tetsembiso letinyenti tekutinikela ngaphasi kweluhlelo lwekulingana kwesitukulwane letitawuphumelela ngekusebentisa lisu lavelonkhe lelisubuciko.

eng: firstly, we are going to drive women’s economic inclusion through public procurement.
ssw: kwekucala, sitawuchuba kufakwa kwabomake kutemnotfo ngekutsenga kwahulumende kwenta loko.

eng: we have set the target of ensuring that at least 40 percent of goods and services procured by public entities are sourced from womenowned businesses.
ssw: sesibeke umgomo wekucinisekisa kutsi lokungenani emaphesenta lange40 etimphahla kanye netinsita letitsengwa tikhungo tahulumende kumabhizinisi banikati bawo kubomake.

eng: secondly, we are going to scale up support for womenowned smmes and for women who work in the informal sector or are unemployed.
ssw: kwesibili, sitakwenyusa kwesekelwa kwemasmme laphetfwe bomake kanye nabomake labasebenta emkhakheni longakahleleki nome labo labangasebenti.

eng: this will include engagement with the financial sector to make financial services accessible and affordable for women.
ssw: loku kutawufaka ekhatsi kuhlanganyela nemkhakha wetetimali kute yenta kutsi tinsita tetetimali tifinyelele kubomake futsi tingabiti.

eng: thirdly, we want to ensure more women have access to productive assets such as land.
ssw: kwesitsatfu, sifuna kucinisekisa kutsi bomake labanengi bayakhona kufinyelela kutfola timphahla letikhicitako njengemhlaba.

eng: it is essential that women are beneficiaries of the accelerate land reform programme.
ssw: kubalulekile kutsi bomake kuba ngibo labazuzako eluhlelweni lolusheshako lwekugucula temhlaba.

eng: it is significant that of the r75 million in covid19 relief earmarked for farming input vouchers 53 percent of the beneficiaries will be rural women.
ssw: kubaluleke kakhulu kutsi kule tigidzi letinger75 tekuhhamula tecovid19 letibekelwe eceleni tekulima, emavawusha emaphesenti lange53 ebazuzi kufanele kutsi kube bomake basetindzaweni tasemaphandleni.

eng: we must ensure that women subsistence and smallscale farmers continue to receive support beyond the pandemic.
ssw: kufanele kutsi sicinisekise kutsi balimi lababomake labalimela kutondla kanye nebalimi labancane bayachubeka kutfola kwesekelwa ngisho ngemuva kwalolubhubhane selwendlulile.

eng: fourthly, we want to ensure that women are protected from genderbased violence in the workplace.
ssw: kwesine, sifuna kucinisekisa kutsi bomake bayavikeleka ebudloveni lobeyame ebulilini etindzaweni tekusebenta.

eng: in this regard, we will be working at a national and regional level towards the ratification of the ilo convention on violence and harassment in the workplace.
ssw: ngaleyo ndlela, sitawube sisebenta ezingeni lavelonkhe kanye neletigodzi ekufeze kiseni sivumelwane somhlangano wenhlangano yetisebenti yemhlaba wonkhe mayelana nebudlova nekugcagcalatiswa etindzaweni tekusebenta.

eng: it is said that freedom is not given, but taken.
ssw: kutsiwa inkhululeko ayinikwa kodvwa iyatsatfwa.

eng: the emancipation of women is only words on paper unless it is matched by commitment from all sectors of society.
ssw: kukhululwa kwabomake kunga ba ngemagama nje lasephepheni nangabe akuhambisani nekutinikela kwayo yonkhe imikhakha yemmango.

eng: as we prepare for the reconstruction of our economy in the wake of the coronavirus pandemic, we have said that we cannot simply return to where we were before the outbreak of the virus.
ssw: njengaloku silungiselela kwakha kabusha umnotfo wetfu ekubhedvukeni kwalolubhubhane lweligciwane lecorona , sishito kutsi ngeke simane nje sibuyele emuva lapho besikhona ngembikwekubhedvuka kwaleligciwane.

eng: we must build a fundamentally different economy which, among other things, substantially improves the material position of women.
ssw: kufanele kutsi sakhe umnotfo lowehlukile mbamba, emkhatsini waletinye tintfo, lotawutfutfukisa ngalokuphatsekako simo sekuba nemphahla kwabomake.

eng: this means that our investment in infrastructure must support not only the development of local industry, but also womenowned businesses.
ssw: loku kusho kutsi lutjalotimali lwetfu kusakhiwonchanti lufanele kutsi lungasekeli kuphela imboni yendzawo kodvwa emabhizinisi laphetfwe bomake.

eng: it must deliberately create employment opportunities for women in all stages of planning, financing, building and maintaining infrastructure.
ssw: lufanele kutsi ludale ngenhloso ematfuba ekucashwa kwabomake kuto tonkhe tigaba tekuhlela, kusitwa ngetimali, kwakha kanye nekugcina esimeni lesisebentako sakhiwonchanti.

eng: by the same measures, as we scale up our public employment programmes, we must ensure that young women in particular are identified as participants.
ssw: ngaleto tinyatselo letifananako, njengaloku senyusa kwesekelwa kwetinhlelo tahulumende tekucasha, kufanele kutsi sicinisekise kutsi bantfu labasha besifazane ikakhulu bayakhetfwa kutsi batimbandzakanye.

eng: in addition to an income, these programmes will provide them with an opportunity to acquire some of the skills and experience necessary to enter the mainstream economy.
ssw: kwengeta kumalingena, letinhlelo titawubanika litfuba lekutfola lamanye emakhono kanye nesipiliyoni lesidzingekako sekungena kutemnotfo letibanti.

eng: as much as it is government’s responsibility to provide economic opportunities for women and create an enabling framework for advancing gender equality, everyone in society needs to play their part.
ssw: nanome kusibopho sahulumende kunika bomake ematfuba etemnotfo kanye nekudala luhlakamsebenti lolukhona kuchubeleembili kulingana ngebulili, wonkhe umuntfu emmangweni kudzingeka kutsi adlale indzima yakhe.

eng: businesses must support womenowned enterprises in the procurement of goods and services.
ssw: emabhizinisi kufanele kutsi asekele emabhizinisi laphetfwe bomake ngekutsi atsenge timphahla netinsita tawo.

eng: they should employ more women and appoint more women to management positions.
ssw: kufanele kutsi acashe bomake labanengi futsi acashe kakhulu bomake etikhundleni tekulawula.

eng: this is all the more important considering that the private sector’s record on genderrepresentation at management level lags behind that of the public sector.
ssw: loku yintfo lebalulekile lebonakalako kutsi lirekhodi lemkhakha lotimele lelimayelana nekumeleleka kwebulili esigabeni sekulawula kusasilele emuva kunemkhakha wahulumende.

eng: this is an issue that is repeatedly raised in engagements i have had with a number of women’s business organisations.
ssw: lena yindzaba lokukhulunywa ngayo njalo ngekuphindzelela ekuhlanganeni kwami netinhlangano temabhizinisi letinengi tabomake.

eng: by equal measure, we must eliminate gender disparities in pay for men and women, and give effect to the principle of equal pay for equal work contained in the employment equity act.
ssw: ngesinyatselo lesilinganako, kufanele kutsi sikucedze kungalingani ngebulili emiholweni yemadvodza nabomake, sisebentise umtsetfomgomo lotsi umholo lolinganako wemsebenti lolinganako locuketfwe mtsetfo wekulingana emsebentini.

eng: women must also be protected from harassment and discrimination in the workplace.
ssw: bomake kufanele kutsi bavikelwe kutsi bangagcagcalatwa futsi bangabandlululwa etindzaweni tekusebenta.

eng: it is up to transport operators, university administrators, school governing bodies and religious organisations to create conditions for women and girls to travel, study and worship in safety.
ssw: kusemahlombe alabanetekutfutsa, baphatsi bemanyu vesi, imitimba lephetse tikolo kanye netinhlangano tetenkholo kutsi tidale kutsi kube netimo tekutsi bomake nemantfombatana bakhone kuhamba, kufundza kanye nekukhonta ngekuphepha.

eng: we must forge ahead with our efforts to eradicate chauvinism, sexism and patriarchy.
ssw: kufanele kutsi sichubekeleembili ngemitamo yetfu yekucedza umcondvo wekudzelela bomake, umcondvo wekubukela phasi bulili kanye nemcondvo wekutsi labadvuna bancono.

eng: it is up to us – both men and women – to affirm that a woman’s value, position and opinions are no less than that of a man.
ssw: kukitsi sonkhe – emadvodza nabomake – kucinisekisa lizingagugu lamake, sikhundla kanye nemibono yabo kutsi ayisingaphasi kweyendvodza.

eng: it is up to us as parents and grandparents to treat and raise our sons and our daughters the same.
ssw: kukitsi njengebatali kanye nabomkhulu nabogogo kutsi siphatse futsi sikhulise emadvodzana kanye nemadvodzakati etfu ngendlela lefananako.

eng: it is up to us as men to reject and speak out against genderbased violence wherever we see it, even if it is against our friends, fathers or brothers.
ssw: kukitsi njengemadvodza kutsi singabuvumeli futsi sikhulume simelane nebudlova lobeyame ebulilini nangabe sibubona, ngisho nome ngabe bucondziswe kubangani betfu, kubobabe nome kubomnaketfu.

eng: let us be the generation that ends the oppression of women in all its forms, in our lifetime.
ssw: asibeni situkulwane lesicedza kucindzetelwa kwabomake kwato tonkhe tinhlobo, esikhatsini sekuphila kwetfu.

eng: the brave generation of 1956 marched for us all.
ssw: situkulwane lesinesibindzi sanga1956 sashucela egameni letfu sonkhe.

eng: back to work after covid19 a full guide allison cooper when can you return to work if you have tested positive for the coronavirus (covid19)?
ssw: kubuyela emsebentini emva kwekwelulama ekuphatfweni yicovid19 allison cooper ungabuyela nini emuva emsebentini emva kweku hlolwa ukhandzakale kutsi uneligciwane lecorona (icovi d19)?

eng: the national institute for communicable diseases has the answers you need.
ssw: sikhungo savelonkhe setitfo letitsatselanako sinetimphendvulo lotidzingako.

eng: when i test positive for covid19, how long do i have to stay in isolation?
ssw: nangabe ngihlolwe nga nangabe ngihlolwe nga khandzakala kutsi nginekhandzakala kutsi nginecocovid19vid19 , kufanele kutsi ngihlale , kufanele kutsi ngihlale sikhatsi lesingakanani ngedvwasikhatsi lesingakanani ngedvwa ?

eng: people who test positive for covid19, but don’t have any symptoms, must remain in isolation at home or in a government isolation facility for 10 days, from the day they receive their positive test result.
ssw: bantfu labahlolwe bakhandzakala kutsi banecovid19 , kodvwa bete timphawu, kufanele kutsi bahlale bodvwa ekhaya nome kusisetjentiswa sahulumende sekuhlala wedvwa tinsuku le10, kusukela ngalelo langa labatfola ngalo imiphumela yabo yeluhlolo letsi banaleligciwane.

eng: those who have mild symptoms must remain in isolation at home or in a government isolation facility for 10 days, from the day their symptoms start.
ssw: labo labanetimphawu letisemkhatsini kufanele kutsi bahlale bodvwa ekhaya nome kusisetjentiswa sahulumende sekuhlala wedvwa tinsuku le10, kusukela ngelilanga timphawu tabo tacala kubonakala.

eng: those who have severe disease, who have to go to hospital, must remain in isolation for 10 days, from when they are stable and don’t need oxygen anymore.
ssw: labo labanetimphawu letimbi kakhulu talesifo, kufanele kutsi baye esibhedlela, kufanele kutsi bahlale babodvwa tinsuku le10, kusukela lapho nasebasimeme futsi bangawudzingi umoyamphilo.

eng: how can a covid19 positive people transfer the disease to others?
ssw: bantfu labanebantfu labanecovid19covid19bangasendlulisela njani lesifo bangasendlulisela njani lesifo kulabanye?

eng: according to health minister zweli mkhize, most people who have a mild infection can spread the virus for between seven to 12 days.
ssw: ngekusho kwendvuna yetemphi lo zweli mkhize, bantfu labanyenti labanekutseleleka ngalesifo lokuncane bangalibhebhetsekisa leligciwane emkhatsini wetinsuku letisikhombisa kanye nale12.

eng: however, people who become very sick could be infectious and be able to transmit the virus to others for a longer period of time.
ssw: nanome kunjalo, bantfu labagula kakhulu bangabanga kutsatselane kwalesifo futsi bangakhona kulendlulisa kulabanye sikhatsi lesidze.

eng: do i have to have another covid19 test, proving that i am negative, before i return to work?
ssw: ngabe kufanele kutsi ngente ngabe kufanele kutsi ngente lolunye luhlolo lwelolunye luhlolo lwecovid19covid19 , , kufakazela kutsi ngite leligciwane, kufakazela kutsi ngite leligciwane, ngembikwekutsi ngibuyele emse ngembikwekutsi ngibuyele emse bentini?

eng: no.
ssw: bentini?

eng: retesting people who have experienced mild illness and have recovered is not recommended.
ssw: kuhlola bantfu futsi lababe nekugula lokuncane futsi lasebaluleme akukhutsatwa kutsi kwentiwe.

eng: a person is considered safe to return to work and come out of isolation if they are no longer infectious.
ssw: umuntfu utsatseka ngekutsi uphephile kubuyela emsebentini kanye nekubuya ekuhlaleni yedvwa nangabe sebete lufu labangatselelana ngalo.

eng: this means they developed their first symptoms more than 10 days ago and have not had any symptoms for at least three days.
ssw: loku kusho kutsi babe netimphawu tekucala ngetulu ngetinsuku le10 letengca futsi abazange sebabe nanome ngutiphi timphawu lokungenani tinsuku letintsatfu.

eng: in most cases, employees can return to work without testing again if: they have completed 10 days of mandatory quarantine or selfisolation.
ssw: esikhatsini lesinyenti, tisebenti tingabuyela emsebentini ngaphandle kwekutsi tihlolwe futsi nangabe: setiphotfule tinsuku le10 letigunyatiwe tekuhlala babodvwa ngenca yesifo nome yekutihlalela bodvwa.

eng: those who had moderate or severe symptoms undergo a medical evaluation.
ssw: labo lababenetimphawu letisekhatsi nekhatsi nome letimbi kakhulu labahlolwe ngekwetekwelashwa.

eng: they continue to practice personal hygiene and social distancing.
ssw: bayachubeka ngekuhlanteka kwabo kanye nekuchela kulabanye bantfu.

eng: the employer monitors the worker to ensure they do not regress.
ssw: umcashi ucaphela tisebenti kucinisekisa kutsi atibuyeli emva.

eng: they wear a mask, from the date of diagnosis for at least 21 days.
ssw: tifaka sifonyo, kusukela nge lusuku lwekucilongwa lokungenani tinsuku letinge21.

eng: i have tested negative but i still have symptoms.
ssw: ngihlolwe ngakhandzakala kutsi ngihlolwe ngakhandzakala kutsi ngite ligciwane kodvwa solomane ngite ligciwane kodvwa solomane ngisanetimphawu.

eng: what now?
ssw: kutsi kwentekenike nyalo?

eng: it is possible to get a false negative test result.
ssw: kuyenteka kutsi utfole imiphume la yeluhlolo lengasilo liciniso.

eng: this means that your first test could be negative, but you could test positive at a later stage.
ssw: loku kungasho kutsi luhlolo lwakho lwekucala belungasho kutsi uneligciwane, kodvwa ungahlolwa ukhandzakale kutsi unalo emva kwesikhatsi.

eng: if you continue to have covid19 symptoms contact your healthcare professional.
ssw: nangabe solo uchubeka ukhombisa kuba netimphawu tecovid19 tsintsa ingcweti yakho lenakekela ngetemphilo.

eng: what if i am still showing symptoms after 10 days?
ssw: kwentekani nangabe solo ngisakwentekani nangabe solo ngisakhombisa kuba netimphawu emva khombisa kuba netimphawu emva kwetinsuku le10?

eng: it is common for patients to continue to have symptoms for longer than 10 days.
ssw: kuvamisile kutsi tigulane tichu beke tibe netimphawu tinsuku letingetulu kwale10.

eng: full recovery may take several weeks.
ssw: kwelulama lokuphelele kungatsatsa emaviki lamanengi.

eng: if you still have symptoms, seek advice from your healthcare professional.
ssw: nangabe solo usakhombisa kuba netimphawu, funa selulelo sengcweti lenakekela ngetemphilo.

eng: for more information about covid19, visit the national institute for communicable diseases’ website at www.
ssw: kute utfole lwatiso lolwengetiwe lolumayelana necovid19 , vakashela iwebhusayithi yesikhungo savelonkhe setifo letitsatselanako ku:www.

eng: nicd.
ssw: nicd.

eng: managing covid19: at home and at a dedicated facility allison cooper if you are not able to selfisolate, call the national coronavirus hotline at 0800 029 999 for more information about your closest isolation or quarantine facility.
ssw: kulawula icovid19 : ekhaya kanye nakusisetjentiswa lesincunyiwe allison cooper kubaluleke kakhulu kutsi kakhulu kutsi wehlukane nalabanye, kungaba kusekhaya nome kusisetjentiswa wehlukane nalabanye, kungaba kusekhaya nome kusisetjentiswa longahlala kuso wedvwa, nangabe uhlolwe wakhandzakala kutsi uneligciwane lelongahlala kuso wedvwa, nangabe uhlolwe wakhandzakala kutsi uneligciwane lecovid19covid19 .. bantfu labanengi baseningizimu afrika labahlolwe bakhandzakala kutsi banaleligciwane lecorona (icovid19) abakhoni kuhlala bodvwa ngobe emakhaya abo mancane kakhulu kutsi bangakhona kuhlala nekulala ekamelweni langalali kanye nalomunye kulo.

eng: it’s extremely important to separate yourself from others, either at home or at a free isolation facility, if you have tested positive for covid19.
ssw: hulumende wente siciniseko sekutsi kube netisetjentiswa letincunyelwe kuhlala wedvwa nangabe uhlolwe wakhandzakala uneligciwane lecorona , kanye futsi netisetjentiswa letincunyelwe kuvalela bantfu ngenca yesifo labo labasalindze imiphumela yeluhlolo lwabo.

eng: both services are free.
ssw: totimbili letinsita titfolakala mahhala.

eng: according to dr marlin mccay, a general practitioner based in florida on the west rand, the first thing you need to do when diagnosed with covid19 is to limit the spread of the infection.
ssw: marlin mccay, longudokotelamvama lolapha eflorida enshonalanga rand, intfo yekucala lekumele kutsi uyente nangabe uhlolwe wakhandzalaka kutsi unaleligciwane lecovid19 kutsi ukhawule kubhebhetse ka kwalolufu.

eng: "you want to protect your family," he says.
ssw: "ufuna kuvikela umndeni wakho," kusho yena.

eng: to do this, you need to go into isolation – either at home or at an isolation facility.
ssw: kute wente loko, kudzingeka kutsi uhlale wedvwa – kungaba kusekhaya nome kube kusisisetjentiswa sekuhlala wedvwa.

eng: "if you are selfisolating it means you have to find a part of the house where you are totally cut off from the rest of the family.
ssw: "nangabe uhleli wedvwa kusho kutsi kufanele kutsi utfole incenye yendlu lapho ungeke utsintsane khona sanhlobo nemalunga onkheemndeni.

eng: no one should come within three metres of you.
ssw: kufanele kutsi kubete umuntfu losondzela kuwe libanga lemamitha lamatsatfu.

eng: you must eat on your own; use your own cutlery and crockery; use your own bathroom, if possible; and make sure there’s no contact with anyone else in the family.
ssw: kufanele kutsi udle wedvwa, usebentise titja takho tekudla; usebentise likamelo lakho wedvwa lekugezela, nangabe kwenteka, futsiungatsintsani ngisho namunye wemalunga emndeni.

eng: "your doctor or primary care giver should help you with certain basic medications to ease most of the symptoms, especially things like body aches and pains, headache and fever.
ssw: "dokotela wakho nome umnakekeli wakho kufanele kutsi akusite ngemitsi lesisekelo kute wehlise timphawu letinkhulu, ikakhulu njengebuhlungu bemtimba, buhlungu benhloko nemfiva.

eng: there are also some good vitamins one can use to stay healthy," he says.
ssw: kunemavithamini futsi lalungile longawasebentisa kute uhlale uphilile," kusho yena njalo.

eng: it’s also important to get enough rest and drink enough water or clear fluids to make sure that your urine stays a pale clear colour.
ssw: kubalulekile futsi kutsi utfole kuphumula lokwanele futsi unatse emanti lanele nome lokusamanti kute wente siciniseko sekutsi umchamo wakho uhlala njalo unembala losamanti.

eng: most people with mild illness will start feeling better within a week of the first symptoms, but it’s important to monitor your symptoms carefully.
ssw: linyenti lebantfu lelinetifo letingasimatima batawucala kutiva sebancono ngesikhatsi lesingaba liviki emva kwetimphawu tekucala, kodvwa kubalulekile kutsi ucaphele timphawu takho ngekucophelela.

eng: if you develop any emergency warning signs, such as trouble breathing, chest pain or pressure in your chest that does not go away, coughing up blood, becoming confused, severe sleepi ness or blue lips or face you must call an ambulance or go to hospital immediately.
ssw: nangabe ukhombisa timphawu letiphutfumako tesecwayiso, njengekubanenkinga yekuphefumula, buhlungu esifubeni nome kucindzeteleka esifubeni lokungapheli, kukhwehlela ingati, kusangana, kuphelelwa butfongo lokukhulu, tindzebe temlomo letiluhlata nome buso lobuhlata kufanele kutsi ubite iambulensi nome uye esibhedlela ngekushesha.

eng: for those who are not able to keep themselves away from others living in the home, government has setup free quarantine facilities around the country to keep you and your loved ones safe.
ssw: tisetjentiswa tekuhlaliswa wedvwa ngenca yesifolabo labangakhoni kuhlala bodvwa bahlukane nemalunga emndeni labahlala nawo ekhaya, hulumende ubeke tisetjentiswa tamahhala tekuhlala wedvwa ngenca yesifo eveni lonkhe kute kutsiugcineke uphephile wena kanye nalobatsandzako.

eng: the western cape government recently published some comments from patients about its isolation facilities.
ssw: hulumende wasenshonalanga kapa ushicilele kuphawula lokushiwo tigulane mayela na netisetjentiswa tawo teku hlalisa bantfu ngabodvwana.

eng: marie jantjies from witzenberg decided to follow healthcare workers’ advice and go to the isolation facility because her 97yearold mother lives with her and her children and she wanted to protect them.
ssw: marie jantjies wasewitzenberg wancuma kulandzela seluleko sebanakekeli betemphilo ngekutsi aye kusisetjentiswa sekuhlala ngawedvwana ngobe make wakhe loneminyaka lenge97 uhlala naye kanye nebantfwabakhe ngakoke bekafuna kubavikela.

eng: "i was treated very well.
ssw: "ngaphatfwa kahle kakhulu.

eng: i realised i just had to stay positive.
ssw: ngabona kutsi kufanele nje kutsi ngihlale nginelitsemba.

eng: i was anxious, but i prayed and tried to relax," she said.
ssw: bengikhatsatekile, kodvwa ngathandaza futsi ngalinga kutsi ngikhululeke," kwasho yena njalo.

eng: "that place can save lives!
ssw: "leyo ndzawo ingasindzisa timphilo!

eng: it really is the best," said john arnoldus, who recovered from covid19 at an isolation facility in drakenstein.
ssw: iyindzawo lencono kakhulu sibili," kwasho john arnoldus, loluleme emva kwekutfolwa anecovid19 losendzaweni yekuhlala uwedvwa lelapha edrakenstein.

eng: "one of my friends was in quarantine at home and he struggled to recover on his own.
ssw: "munye webangani bekahleli yedvwa ekhaya ngenca yesifo wadvonsa kamatima kutsi alulame ngekwakhe.

eng: i told him to contact the people who cared for me – that is the way to get better.
ssw: ngamtjela kutsi atsintse bantfu labamnakekela – ngiyo indlela yekuba ncono leyo.

eng: the support of the medical staff and the manager there – that pulls you through," he said.
ssw: kwesekelwa tisebenti tetemphilo kanye nemlawuli walapho – ngiko lokukwenta kutsi ukhone kululama," kwasho yena.

eng: arnoldus was initially hesitant to go to the isolation facility because of the wrong perception that if you go to a facility like this you will get sicker and die.
ssw: arnoldus kwekucala bekangatsita kutsi aye kulesisetjentiswa sekuhlala ngawedvwana ngenca yembono longasilo liciniso lotsi ungaya endzaweni lenjalo utawugula kakhulu futsi ushone.

eng: "i expected the worst, but i was received so well.
ssw: "bengilindzele lokubi kakhulu, kodvwa ngemukelwa kahle kakhulu.

eng: let’s keep each other safe vukuzenzele unnamed our country has moved to alert level 2 in our response to the coronavirus pandemic.
ssw: asigcinaneni siphephile vukuzenzele unnamed live letfu lisesigabeni se2 sekucaphela ekuphendvuleni kwetfu kulolubhubhane lweligciwane lecorona .

eng: this has come as a relief to all south africans who have had to live under stringent restrictions for the last five months.
ssw: loku kufike njengendle la yekuhhamleka kubo bonkhe bantfu baseni ngizimu afrika lebaba phile ngaphasi kwemitse tfo yekuvinjelwa lelukhu ni tinyanga letisihlanu letengcile.

eng: it is a sign of the progress we are making in reducing new infections and demand on our health facilities.
ssw: kuluphawu lwenchu bekelembili lesiyentako ekunciphiseni kusuleleka lokusha ngalesifo kanye nalokutawufuneka kuti setjentiswa tetfu tetemphilo.

eng: it is also a very important development as we strive to restart our economy.
ssw: kuphindze futsi kube yintfu tfuko lebaluleke kakhulu njengaloku silwela kuvusete la umnotfo wetfu.

eng: but it is too soon to celebrate.
ssw: kodvwa kusasekusha kakhulu kutsi singacala sijabule.

eng: we are still very much in the middle of a deadly pandemic that has taken over 11,000 lives in south africa alone.
ssw: sisasekhatsi nekhatsi kwe lubhubhane lolubulalako loseluvele lutsatse timphilo tebantfu baseningizimi afrika kuphela laba11 000. kunetehlakalo letingetulu kwesigidzi tebantfu laba suleleke ngalesifo laba cinisekisiwe, sisakunombolo yesihlanu emaveni emhlaba wonkhe lanekutseleleka ngalesifo lokusesibalweni lesisetulu.

eng: and there is always a chance of a resurgence of the disease.
ssw: kuhlala njalo kunelitfuba lekutsi lesifo siphindze futsi sivuke.

eng: if we ever need a stark reminder of the need for vigilance, we should look to recent events thousands of kilometres away in new zealand.
ssw: nangabe sidzinga sikhu mbuto sesidzingo sekutsi sicaphele, kufanele kutsi sibuke loko lokusandza kwe nteka endzaweni lechele ngetinkhulungwane temakhi lomitha enew zealand.

eng: three months since the country was declared coronavirusfree, new zealand is once again under lockdown.
ssw: emva kwetinyanga letintsa tfu lelo live limemetele kutsi sekute ligciwane lecorona kulo, inew zealand seyi phindze futsi yabangaphasi kwekumiswa kwekusebenta kwetintfo kwavelonkhe.

eng: although the latest outbreak was of relatively few cases, the government swiftly reimposed lockdown restrictions.
ssw: nanome lokubhedvuka kwamuva kube netehlakalo letimbalwa, hulumende ngekushesha umemetele futsi imitsetfo yekumiswa kusebenta kwetintfo kwavelonkhe.

eng: similar restrictions have had to be reimposed in several parts of europe as they experience a ‘second wave’ of infections.
ssw: imitsetfo yekuvimbela iphi ndze futsi yamenyetelwa etincenyeni letinengi tase yurophu ngesikhatsi tihla ngabetana ‘neligagasi lesibili’ lekusuleleka ngalesifo.

eng: these experiences show just how swiftly things can change when it comes to covid19.
ssw: loku kukhomba ngalokucacile kutsi tintfo tingagucuka njani masinyane nangabe kukhu lunywa ngecovid19 .

eng: it is a wakeup call to any among us who may harbour illusions that we are even close to seeing the end of this grave public health emergency.
ssw: kuyindlela yekusipha phamisa tsine sonkhe lesi ngacabanga ngekutikho hlisa sitsi sesisondzele kubona siphetfo salesimo lesiphutfumako setemphilo yemmango.

eng: certainly, there are signs of hope.
ssw: ecinisweni, kunetinkhomba telitsemba.

eng: the number of new confirmed cases in south africa continues to decline.
ssw: linani lete hlakalo lebatfu labasuleleke ngalesifo lapha eningizimu afrika liyachubeka ngekwe hla.

eng: at the peak of the disease just one month ago, we were recording around 12,000 new cases a day.
ssw: ngesikhatsi lokwesule leka ngalesifo kwenyuke kakhulu enyangeni nje yinye leyengcile, besitfola tehlakalo letinsha tekwesuleleka le tilinganiselwa kuleti12 000 ngelilanga.

eng: this has dropped to an average of around 5,000 a day over the past week.
ssw: loko sekwehle kwalinganiselwa kuavareji leti5 000 ngelilanga kuleli viki lelengcile.

eng: our recovery rate stands at 80 percent.
ssw: lizinga letfu lebantfu labelulamako lime kumaphesenti lange80.

eng: as the country moves to alert level 2, many restrictions on social and economic activity have been lifted.
ssw: njengaloku lelive selingena esigabeni se2 sekucaphela, imitsetfo levimbelako lemi nengi lemayelana netenhla lo kanye nemisebenti ye temnotfo seyisusiwe.

eng: with this comes increased risk of transmission.
ssw: loku kuhamba nebungoti lobe nyukile bekwesuleleka ngalesifo.

eng: we now need to manage this risk and ensure the gains we have made thus far in containing the pandemic’s spread are not reversed.
ssw: nyalo kudzingeka kutsi sibulawule lobungoti kanye nekucinisekisa kutsi loko lesikuzuzile kute kube ngunyalo ekuvimbeni kutsi kubhebhetseka kwalesifo kungabuyeli emuva.

eng: the greatest threat to the health of nation right now is complacency.
ssw: ingoti lenkhulukati kutemphilo tesive njengalo kukhobosa.

eng: it may be that we are now permitted to meet friends and family, to visit entertainment venues, to travel for leisure and to consume alcohol in restaurants, bars and taverns.
ssw: kungaba kutsi nyalo sesi vunyelwe kutsi sihlangane nebangani nemindeni, si vakashele tindzawo tekuti jabulisa, sitsatse luhambo lwekushaya ngumoya sikhibike kanye nekunatsa tjwala etindzaweni lapho ku tsengwa khona kudla uhla le phasi udle, emabhaleni nasemathaveni.

eng: but as the old adage goes, just because you can, doesn’t mean you should.
ssw: kodvwa njengaloku inkhu lumo lehlakaniphile itsi, kutsi intfo uyakhona kuye nta, akusho kutsi kufanele kutsi uyente.

eng: many people who have the coronavirus do not have symptoms and may not even know they are infected.
ssw: bantfu labanengi laba naleligciwane lecorona bete timphawu talo futsi kungenteka kutsi abati ne kwati kutsi basulelekile.

eng: this is a sobering reality because it means that any of us could be infected right now and could unwittingly infect others.
ssw: leli liciniso leletfusako ngobe kusho kutsi nome ngabe ngu muphi lomunye wetfu ku ngenteka kutsi wesulelekile njengaloku sikhuluma futsi kungenteka kutsi ngekungati utselela labanye.

eng: this is particular the case when visiting relatives, especially the elderly and those with preexisting medical conditions that render them vulnerable to infection.
ssw: loku kwenteka ngesikhatsi umuntfu avakashela tihlobo, ikakhulu bantfu labadzala kanye nalabo labanetimo tetekwelashwa taphambilini loko kubenta kutsi batse leleke lula ngaleligciwane.

eng: it is also true for attending religious services or cultural activities.
ssw: kuphindze futsi kube liciniso nangelesikhatsi umuntfu aya etinkonzweni tetenkolo nome imisebenti yetemasiko.

eng: the ‘second wave’ of infections that several other countries have experienced is an everpresent possibility for us too.
ssw: ‘leligagasi lesibili’ leku tseleleka ngalesifo emave lamanengi lahlangabetane nalo yintfo lengenteka nome kunini nakitsi.

eng: although many restrictions have been lifted, it does not mean they will not return should we experience a significant rise in infections.
ssw: nanome imi tsetfo yekuvimbela lemine ngi seyisusiwe, akusho kutsi ngeke ibuyiswe nangabe sihlangabetana nekwenyuka lokukhulu kwekutseleleka ngalesifo.

eng: this pandemic is a matter of life and death.
ssw: lolubhubhane luyindzaba yekufa neku phila.

eng: we need to adapt and we need to be vigilant.
ssw: kudzingeka kutsi sitetayetise futsi sicaphele.

eng: in the days, weeks and months that lie ahead, we must urgently focus our efforts on recovery.
ssw: kulamalanga, emaviki kanye netinyanga letila ndzelako, kufanele kutsi ngekushesha sigcile kumi tamo yetfu yekuvusetela.

eng: our economy and our society has suffered a great deal.
ssw: umnotfo wetfu kanye nesive setfu sikhahlabeteke kakhu lu.

eng: as we return to economic activity across almost all industries – and work to repair the damage done – we have a responsibility to not let our guard down as individuals, employers, communities, families, professionals, workers and citizens.
ssw: njengaloku sibuyela kuyowusebenta cishe kuto tonkhe timboni kanye nekusebentela kulungisa lo monakalo lowentekile – sine sibopho sekungayekeleli nje singacapheli lowo nalowo, bacashi, imimango, imi ndeni, bongcweti, tisebenti kanye netakhamuti.

eng: none of us wants a return to the early days of extreme lockdown restrictions.
ssw: kute namunye wetfu lofuna kubuyela emuva kulamalanga ekucala emi tsetfo yekuvimbela lecinile.

eng: we want to move on with our lives.
ssw: sifuna kuchubekela embili nemphilo yetfu.

eng: we want our friends and loved ones to remain healthy and safe.
ssw: sifuna kutsi bangani betfu kanye nalabo betfu lesibatsandzako kutsi bahlale njalo baphilile futsi baphephile.

eng: as a nation, let us continue to work together to ensure that we progress.
ssw: njengesive, asichubekeni sisebente ngekuhlanga nyela kucinisekisa kutsi si chubekele embili.

eng: the move to alert level 2 of the lockdown is not a ‘free for all.’ the rules on social distancing, mask wearing, social gatherings and international travel remain.
ssw: kungena esigabeni se2 sekucaphela sekumiswa kwekwenteka kwetintfo kwavelonkhe akusho kutsi ‘inkhululeko yako konkhe’.

eng: nsfas powered my dreams more matshediso the national student financial aid scheme (nsfas) has bridged the financial gap between karabo mashego (21) and his plan to further his studies.
ssw: insfas yaphumelelisa emaphupho ami more matshediso sikimu savelonkhe sekusita titjudeni ngetimali (nsfas) sivale leligeba letimali emkhatsini kwa karabo mashego (21) naseluhlelweni lwakhe lwekuchubeka ngetifu ndvo takhe.

eng: mashego of sebokeng in gauteng’s vaal area says he would not have managed to afford tuition fees and the other expenses that come with postmatric education had he not received a bursary from nsfas.
ssw: mashego wasesebokeng egauteng endzaweni yasevaal utsi bekangeke akhone kukhokhela imali yekufundza naletinye ti ndleko letita nekuchubeka kufundza emva kweku photfula matikuletjeni uma bekangakatfoli umfundzate lobuya kunsfas.

eng: "in addition, the monthly allowance i receive from nsfas enables me to sleep and study on a full stomach," he says.
ssw: "kwengeta, imali lengiyi tfola njalo ngenyanga levela kunsfas ingenta ngi khone kulala futsi ngi fundze ngisutsi," usho njalo.

eng: mashego is a thirdyear student studying towards a degree in civil engineering at the university of pretoria.
ssw: mashego ungumfundzi lowenta umnyaka wesitsa tfu kutifundvo tebunjiniye la enyunivesi yasepretoria.

eng: "tuition fees are very expensive.
ssw: "tindleko tekufundza tibi ta kakhulu.

eng: for the course that i have chosen, i really could not afford to pay for a semester, never mind a single academic year," he explains.
ssw: kuletifundvo lengitikhetsile, ecinisweni bengingeke ngikhone kukhokhela tinyanga letisitfupha, angisakhulumi ngemnyaka wekufundza lowodvwa," uyachaza.

eng: mashego matriculated in 2016 and was a top learner in his class, but had no means to pay for his studies.
ssw: mashego watfola mati kuletjeni ngemnyaka we2016 futsi bekamfundzi lowaphuma embili eklasini lakhe, kodvwa angenayo indlela yekukhokhela tifundvo takhe.

eng: he successfully applied for funding from nsfas for the 2018 academic year.
ssw: sicelo sakhe selusito lwetimali kunsfas saphumelela ngemnyaka wekufundza we2018.

eng: "this gave me the opportunity to make my dream of studying engineering come true.
ssw: "loku kwanginika litfuba lekuphumelelisa liphupho lami lekufundzela bunji niyela.

eng: education plays a huge role in my personal development and it helps me to progress in all that i intend to achieve.
ssw: imfundvo idlala indzima lenkhulu ekuti tfutfukiseni futsi iyangisita kutsi ngichubekele embili kuko konkhe bengifisa ku phumelela kuko.

eng: moreover, it empowers me to empower other people in my community and thus contribute to the economy of our country," mashego explains.
ssw: ngetulu kwaloko, inginika emandla ekutfutfukisa labanye ba ntfu emmangweni wanga kitsi ngaloko ifaka ligalelo kumnotfo walelive letfu," kuchaza mashego.

eng: "i urge young people to apply for nsfas funding because following your dream is not a free exercise, it needs funding, and nsfas will bridge that gap for you," he says.
ssw: "ngincusa bantfu labasha kutsi bafake ticelo telusito lwetimali kunsfas ngoba kuphumelelisa liphupho lakho akuchamuki ma hhala, kudzinga lusito lwetimali, kantsi insfas itakuvalela lelo geba," usho njalo.

eng: the minister of higher education, science and innovation, dr blade nzimande, has opened the nsfas 2021 application cycle for a period of four months, from 3 august to 30 november 2020. students from disadvan taged and workingclass backgrounds who wish to further their studies at any public technical and vocational education and training (tvet) college or university may apply.
ssw: indvuna yetemfundvo lephakeme,yetesayensi neyetekucanjwa kwaloku sha, dkt.

eng: to be eligible for nsfas funding, an applicant must be a south african citizen and come from a family with a combined annual household income of not more than r350 000. the household annual income for students with a disability should not be more than r600 000.
ssw: blade nzimande, sevele uvule sikhatsi lesitinyanga letine temjikeleto wemnyaka we2021 weku faka ticelo kunsfas, ku suka mhla ti3 ingci kuya kumhla ti30 lweti 2020. titjudeni lebetincishwe ematfuba phambilini naleteswele letifisa ku chubeka netifundvo tato kunoma nguliphi likolishi lahulumende letethekhni khi neletemakhono kute mfundvo netekuceceshwa (tvet) noma enyunivesi tingafaka ticelo.

eng: "in the current academic year, nsfas has funded over 700 000 students, 248 242 at tvet colleges and 481 339 at universities (students with registrations data).
ssw: kute ukhone kutfola kusekelwa ngetimali yinsfas, lofaka sicelo kufuneka abe sakhamuti saseningizimu afrika futsi abe aphuma emnde nini lonelinani lemholo seli hlangene lonkhe lemnya ka lelingengci r350 000. lemali leholwa ngumndeni ngemnyaka yetitjudeni letinekukhubateka akufu neki ibe ngetulu kwer600 000.

eng: nsfas accounts for 40 percent of the undergraduate population at universi ties and 70 percent at tvet colleges.
ssw: "kulomnyaka lona weku fundza, insfas isekele ngetimali titjudeni letinge tulu kwe700 000, leti248 242 letisemakolishi etvet naleti481 339 letisema nyunivesi (titjudeni letikho mbisa kutsi setibhalisiwe).

eng: v applicants must visit www.
ssw: vindlela longafaka ngayo sicelo labafaka sicelo kufuneka bavakashele www.

eng: nsfas.
ssw: nsfas.

eng: org.
ssw: org.

eng: za and click on mynsfas.
ssw: z a bese bachafata kumynsfas .

eng: they must create a mynsfas account, click the apply tab, answer the questions on screen and upload the required documents.
ssw: kufuneka bativulele iakhawunti yemynsfas , chafata inki nobho letsi apply, phendvula imibuto lekusikrini bese ufaka emadokhumenti ladzingekako.

eng: once that is done, they must click submit.
ssw: uma loku sebakwentile, kufuneka bachafate submit .

eng: after clicking submit, the application reference number will appear on the screen.
ssw: emva kwekuchafata submit , ino mbolo leyireferensi yesicelo sakho itawuvela kusikrini.

eng: the reference number will also be sent to the cellphone number and email address that the applicant provided.
ssw: lenombolo leyirefe rensi itawuphindza itfunyelwe kunombo lo yamakhalekhikhini wakho nakulikheli leimeyili leliniketwe ngilofaka sicelo.

eng: applicants can use a cellphone, tablet or computer to apply.
ssw: labafaka sicelo bangasebentisa makhalekhikhini, ithebulethi noma ikho mpiyutha kufaka sicelo.

eng: the nsfas portal has undergone minor changes to make it easier to use and more secure.
ssw: iphothali yensfas ibe netingucuko letincane le tenta kutsi kube malula kuyisebentisa netekukhulisa kuvikeleka.

eng: new applicants need a copy of their id or birth certificate to register and create a profile on the mynsfas portal.
ssw: labafaka sicelo kwekucala kufuneka babe nekhophi yeid noma yesitifiketi sekutalwa kute babhalise bese batakhela iphrofayili kuphothali yamynsfas .

eng: applicants with existing accounts need to log into their accounts – remember, only one profile per applicant is allowed.
ssw: labafaka sicelo lesevele baneakhawunti kufuneka bangene kuakhawunti yabo – khumbula, kuvumeleke iphrofayili leyo dvwa kuphela kuloyo lofaka sicelo.

eng: the applicant must give consent for their personal information to be checked by a third party and if they do not agree to this, they will not be allowed to continue with the application process.
ssw: labafaka sicelo kufuneka bavume kutsi lwatiso lolumayelana nabo luhlolwe ngu muntfu wesitsatfu kodvwa uma banga vumelani naloku, angeke bavunyelwe kuchubeka nenchubo yekufaka sicelo.

eng: as a result of the coronavirus pandemic, applicants will not be required to submit or upload the consent form.
ssw: ngenca yalobhubhane weligciwane lecorona, labafaka sicelo angeke kudzi ngeke kutsi batfumele noma bafake lifomu lekunika imvumo.

eng: instead, they will be asked to accept the conditions on the electronic consent form, along with the terms and conditions for funding.
ssw: kunaloko, batawucelwa kutsi bavume imibandzela lekulifomu lekuvuma lelielekhthronikhi, lelihambisana nemigomo nemibandzela yekutfola lusito lwetimali.

eng: protect our women and children vukuzenzele unnamed a year ago, almost to the day, thousands of wom en, men and children marched to parliament to protest against a spate of rapes and killings of women and girls.
ssw: vikela bomake nebantfwana betfu vukuzenzele unnamed kulomnyaka lo phelile, cishe ngulelilanga leli, tinkhulungwane tabomake, bobabe nebantfwana bashuca balibangisa ephalamende bayokhala ngekubhebhetseka kwekudlwengula nekubulawa kwabomake nebantfwana.

eng: at the time, the nation was reeling from the murders of uyinene mrwetyana, leighandre jegels, jesse hess and a number of other women who had lost their lives at the hands of brutal men.
ssw: ngaleso sikhatsi, sive besisebu hlungwini lobukhulu bekubulawa kukauyinene mrwetyana, leighandre jegels, jesse hess kanye nalabanye bomake labanyenti laba lahlekelwa timphilo tabo etandleni temadvodza lanesibhuku.

eng: from all social backgrounds, young and old, students and working women, the peaceful protesters held aloft placards that read ‘enough is enough’ and ‘am i next?’.
ssw: kuyo yonkhe imikhakha yetenhlalo, labadzala nalabancane, titjudeni nabomake labasebentako, lababhikishi labebashuca ngekuthula bebaphetse tigwabhugwabhu lebetibhalwe kutsi 'enough is enough ' futsi ' am i next?'

eng: the anguish and the anger was palpable that day.
ssw: buhlungu nentfukutselo lejulile ngalelo langa.

eng: as i received their clearly articulated demands, it was clear to me that we needed to act urgently and with determination.
ssw: ngesikhatsi ngemukela tidzingo tabo lebebatifuna nge mandla lebetibekwe ngalokucacile, kwangikhanyela kutsi sidzinga kutsa tsa tinyatselo ngalokuphutfumako nangekutimisela.

eng: it was important to me that i did not respond with hollow words and empty promises.
ssw: kimi bekubalulekile kutsi ngingaphendvulinje ngemagama lalula netitsembiso letingenalutfo.

eng: a few days later, i called a joint sitting of parliament, where we announced a r1.6 billion emergency response action plan to combat genderbased violence and femicide (gbvf).
ssw: ngemuva kwemalanga lambalwa, ngabita umhlangano wetindlu tephalamende totimbili, lapho khona samemetela lisutinyatselo lekuphendvula ngekuphutfuma letigidzigidzi letir1.6 lekulwa nebudlova lobucondziswe kubulili lobutsite kanye nekubulawa kwalabasikati (igbvf).

eng: over the six months of its implementation, public spending in various government departments was reprioritised to support interventions for care and support for survivors, for awareness and prevention campaigns, to improve laws and policies, to promote the economic empowerment of women, and to strengthen the criminal justice system.
ssw: kuletinyanga letisitfupha tekufezekisa, kusetjentiswa kwemali yahulu mende ematikweni ahulumende la manyenti kwabekwa embili kute kutsi kwesekelwe tingenelelo tekunakekela kanye nekwesekelwa kwalabasindzile labanyenti, kwesekelwe imikhankhaso yekucaphelisa nekuvikela, kwenta kancono imitsetfo netinchubomgomo, kukhutsata kuhlonyiswa kwabomake ngetemnotfo, kanye nekucinisa inchubo yetebulungiswa betebugebengu.

eng: and now we are on the cusp of the most farreaching legislative overhaul in the fight against gbvf.
ssw: manje sisezingeni lekulungisa kushaywa kwemtsetfo lokutawuba nelifutse lelikhulu ekulweni negbvf .

eng: three key bills relating to gbvf have been introduced in parliament recently.
ssw: kusandza kwetfulwa ephalamende imitsetfosivivinyo lemitsatfu lemikhulu lephatselene negbvf .

eng: through the introduction of these bills, we are honouring the promise we made to the protestors last year and to all the women of this country.
ssw: ngekunge niswa kwalemitsetfosivivinyo, sigcina sitsembiso lesasenta kubabhikishi kulomnyaka lophelile nakubo bonkhe bomake balelive.

eng: the three amendment bills are designed to fill the gaps that allow some perpetrators of these crimes to evade justice and to give full effect to the rights of our country’s women and children.
ssw: lemitsetfosivivinyo yekuchibela lemitsatfu yentelwe kugcwalisa tikhala letivumela babhebhetseli balobuge bengu kutsi bagweme bulungiswa kanye nekwenta kutsi emalungelo abomake nebantfwana balelive kutsi asebente ngalokuphelele.

eng: these bills, once finalised, will help to restore the confidence of our country’s women that the law is indeed there to protect them.
ssw: lemitsetfosivivinyo, uma seyi photfuliwe, itawusita kubuyisa kutetsemba kwabomake balelive lakitsi kutsi umtsetfo ukhona ngempela kutewubavikela.

eng: the first is the bill to amend the criminal law (sexual offences and related matters) amendment act.
ssw: lomtsetfosivivinyo wekucala uchibela umtsetfo wetebugebengu (emacala wetemacansi netindzaba letiphatselene nawo) umtsetfo wekuchibela.

eng: this creates a new offence of sexual intimidation, extends the ambit of the offence of incest, and extends the reporting duty of persons who suspect a sexual offence has been committed against a child.
ssw: loku kwenta licala lelisha lekwesabisa ngetemacansi, ukhu lisa bubanti belicala lebundlundlulu, uphindze futsi ukhulisa umsebenti wekubika webantfu labasola kutsi kukhona licala letemacansi lelentiwe kumntfwana.

eng: it expands the scope of the national register for sex offenders (nrso) to include the particulars of all sex offenders.
ssw: ukhulisa bubanti berejista yavenkhe yetigilamkhuba tetemacansi (inrso) kutsi ifake ekhatsi imininingwane yetigilamkhuba tetemacansi.

eng: until now, it has only applied to sex offenders convicted of sex crimes perpetrated against children or persons with mental disabilities.
ssw: kute kube ngumanje, beyiloku isebenta kutigilamkhuba tetemacansi letilahlwe ngemacala ebugebengu betemacansi labhebhetselwa kubantfwana noma bantfu labangaphili kahle engcondvweni.

eng: the time an offender’s particulars must remain on the register has been increased, and those listed on the register will have to disclose this when they submit applications to work with vulnerable persons.
ssw: sikhatsi imininingwane yesigilamkhuba letawusihlala kurejista sikhulisiwe, futsi labo lababhalwe kulerejista batawudzingeka kutsi bakudzalule loku uma bafaka ticelo tabo temisebenti tekusebenta nebantfu labahlaseleka kalula.

eng: the bill also provides for the names of persons on the nrso to be publicly available.
ssw: lomtsetfosivivinyo uphindze ubeke kutsi emagama ebantfu labakunrso afanele kutsi atfolwe sive.

eng: the criminal and related matters amendment bill tightens, among others, the granting of bail to perpetrators of gbvf, and expands the offences for which minimum sentences must be imposed.
ssw: lomtsetfosivivinyo wekuchibela tebugebengu netindzaba letiphatselene naloko ucinisa, emkhatsini waletinye tintfo, kunikwa ibheyili kwebabhebhetseli begbvf , uphindze futsi wengete emacala lafanele kutsi ahlisisebetwe tigwebo letincane.

eng: the amendments impose new obligations on lawenforcement officials and on our courts.
ssw: letichibelo tihlisibeta tibopho letisha kutikhulu tekucinisekisa kugcinwa kwemtsetfo nasetinkantolo tetfu.

eng: when a prosecutor does not oppose bail in cases of gbv, they have to place their reasons on record.
ssw: uma umshushisi angayiphikisi ibheyili emacaleni egbv , bafanele kutsi babhale kumarekhodi tizatfu tabo.

eng: unless a person accused of gbv can provide exceptional circumstances why they should be released on bail, the court must order their detention until the criminal proceedings are concluded.
ssw: ngaphandle uma ngabe umuntfu losolwa kutsi wente licala legbv anganiketa timo letikhetseke kakhulu tekutsi kungani bafanele kutsi bakhululwe ngebheyili, inkantolo ifanele kutsi yente bavalelwe kute kube ngulapho sekuphotfulwe tinchubo tetebugebengu.

eng: in reaching a decision on a bail application, the courts are compelled to take a number of considerations into account.
ssw: ekufinyeleleni tincumo nekufaka sicelo sebheyili, tinkantolo ticindzeteleka kutsi tibuke tintfo letinyenti.

eng: they include pretrial reports on the desirability of releasing an accused on bail, threats of violence made against a survivor, and the view of the survivor regarding his or her safety.
ssw: tifaka ekhatsi imibiko yangembi kwekutekwa kwelicala lemayelana nekufuna kukhululwa kwemsolwa ngebheyili, kwesatjiswa ngebudlova lokwentiwe kulosindzile, kanye nembono waloyo losindzile mayelana nekuphepha kwakhe.

eng: when it comes to parole, a complainant or a relative of a deceased victim must be able to make representation to the parole board.
ssw: mayelana neludzaba lepharoli,ummangali noma sihlobo semufi sifanele kutsi sikwati kwetfula inkhulumo ebhodini yepharoli, uma kubukwa lamazinga lasetulu ngalokungemukeleki ebudlova bebalingani betitsandzani kulelive lakitsi, sesicinise imigomo yemtsetfo webudlova basekhaya.

eng: given the unacceptably high levels of intimate partner violence in our country, we have tightened the provisions of the domestic violence act.
ssw: manje budlova buchazwa ngendlela yekutsi bufaka ekhatsi kukhulumisana, kujola, kubudlelwane besintfu, kwenta mbamba letiphatselene nemacansi noma kutilingisa, budlelwane betemacansi noma budlelwane betemacansi banoma sikhatsi lesingakanani.

eng: domestic violence is now defined to cover those in engagements, dating, in customary relationships, and actual or perceived romantic, intimate or sexual relationships of any duration.
ssw: lomtsetfosivivinyo uphindze futsi welule inchazelo 'yebudlova basekhaya' kutsi ifake ekhatsi kuvikelwa kwebantfu labadzala ekutsini bangahlukunyetwa ngemalunga emndeni.

eng: complainants will be able to apply for a protection order online.
ssw: bamangali batawukwati kufaka sicelo semyalo wenkantolo wekuvikeleka ngekusebentisa tebucwepheshe.

eng: to prevent a scenario where perpetrators can hide past histories of domestic violence, an integrated repository of protection orders will be established.
ssw: kuvikela simo lapho khona babh ebhetseli bangabhaca ngemuva kwemilandvo yesikhatsi lesendlulile yebudlova basekhaya, kutawusungulwa silondvoloti lesihlanganisile semiyalo yekuvikeleka.

eng: the proposed amendments also oblige the departments of social development, basic education, higher education and health to provide certain services to survivors where needed and to refer them for sheltering and medical care.
ssw: letichibelo letiphakanyisiwe tiphindze futsi tetfwese litiko letekutfutfukiswa kwetenhlalo, temfundvo lesisekelo, temfundvo lephakeme netemphilo sibopho sekunika labo labasindzile tinsita letitsite nekubendlulisela etindzaweni tekukhosela nekunakekelwa ngetekwelashwa.

eng: the circumstances under which a prosecutor can refuse to institute a prosecution when offences have been committed under the amended act or to withdraw charges when it involves the infliction of bodily harm or where a weapon was used to threaten a complainant have been limited.
ssw: timo lapho khona umshushisi angala kushushisa uma kwentiwe emacala ngaphansi kwalomtsetfo lochitjelwe noma esule tinhlawulo uma ngabe kufaka ekhatsi kulinyatwa umtimba noma uma ngabe kwasetjentiswa silimato kwesabisa ummangali kunemkhawulo.

eng: in perhaps the most groundbreaking proposed amendment to the act, if someone has knowledge, reasonable belief or suspicion that an act of domestic violence has been committed against a child, a person with disability or an older person and fails to report it to a social worker or police officer they can be fined and even imprisoned.
ssw: mhlawumbe kusichibelo lesiphakanyisiwe lesiyincophamlandvo kulomtsetfo, uma ngabe kunemuntfu lonelwati, kukholelwa lokwenele noma tinsolo tekutsi kukhona sento sebudlova basekhaya lesentiwe kumntfwana, umuntfu lonekukhubateka noma umuntfu lomdzala futsi ehluleke kubikela sonhlalakahle noma liphoyisa bangahlawuliswa noma baboshwe.

eng: similarly, failure by a member of the saps to comply with their obligations under the act will be regarded as misconduct and must be reported to the civilian secretariat for police service.
ssw: ngalokufananako, kwehluleka kwelilunga lesaps kuhambisana netibopho tabo ngaphansi kwemtsetfo kutawutsatfwa njengekungatiphatsi kahle futsi ufanele kutsi abikwe kubomabhalane betemisebenti yemaphoyisa.

eng: the law is the one sure protector of all of society, but especially its most vulnerable.
ssw: umtsetfo ungumvikeli munye wemmango, kepha ikakhulu kulabo bawo labahlaseleka kalula.
