ssw: "esimeni lapho khona umntfwana asuka kulomunye umnakekeli aya kulomunye, lesibonelelo kufuneka simlandzele umntfwana.

eng: the original caregiver is expected to report to sassa that the child is no longer in his/her care, and the new primary caregiver must then come in to apply for the grant," adds letsatsi.
ssw: umnakekeli wekucala kufuneka abike kusassa kutsi umntfwana akasanakekelwa nguye, bese umnakekeli lomusha uyeta atofaka sicelo sesibonelelo," kungeta letsatsi.

eng: letsatsi says people who continue to receive child support grants after the children are no longer in their care, will be required to repay the amount received unlawfully.
ssw: letsatsi utsi bantfu labachubekako kutfola lesondlo semntfwana kube umntfwana akasanakekelwa ngibo, kutawudzingeka kutsi babuyise lemali lebayitfole ngaloku ngekho emtsetfweni.

eng: they may also be subject to criminal prosecution if the intention to defraud the state can be confirmed.
ssw: bangahle futsi bashushiswe ngekwe mtsetfo uma kungavela kutsi bebahlose kukhwabanisa.

eng: the same consequences apply to people who misuse care dependency grants – which are given by sassa to provide financial support to children with severe disabilities who require fulltime care, disability grants or older persons grants.
ssw: loku kungenteka nasebantfwini labasebentisa kabi sondlo semntfwana – lebayiniketwe yisassa kutsi basekele ngetimali ba ntfwana labanekukhubateka lokukhulu labadzinga kunakekelwa ngaso sonkhe sikhatsi, kungaba sondlo sekukhubateka noma sondlo sekuluphala.

eng: "if the money is used for alcohol, drugs or gambling, and not for the support of the person who qualifies for the grant, the same process of reporting should be followed," says letsatsi.
ssw: "uma ngabe lemali isetjentiselwa kunatsa tjwala, tidzakwamiva noma kuge mbula, ingakasebenti kusekela umuntfu lofanelekile kutsi ayitfole, lenchubo lengenhla yekubika kutawufuneka ilandzelwe," kusho letsatsi.

eng: who can apply for child support grant?
ssw: ngubani longafaka sicelo sesondlo sekusekela umntfwana?

eng: according to letsatsi, any south african citizen, permanent resident or documented refugee who cares for a child, whether or not that child is his or her biological child, may apply for a child support grant, provided he/she meets the criteria listed below: the child and caregiver must live permanently in south africa.
ssw: ngekusho kwaletsatsi, kungaba ngunoma ngumuphi umuntfu wase ningizimu afrika, losakhamuti ngalokuphelele noma losifikanemtfwalo lonemaphepha lonakekela umntfwana, akukhatsalekile kutsi umntfwana wakhe noma akusuye wakhe ngekutalwa, angafaka sicelo sesibonelelo sekunakekela umntfwana, uma nje kungumake noma kungubabe lohambisana naletidzingo letilandzelako: umntfwananemnakekeli kufuneka babe takhamuti taseningizimu afrika ngalokuphelele.

eng: the caregiver must be 16 years of age (in the case of childheaded households) or older.
ssw: umnakekeli kufuneka abe neminyaka le16 budzala (esimeni semindeni lephe tfwe ngumntfwana) noma ngetulu.

eng: the child must be younger than 18. the grant recipient must be the child’s primary caregiver and the child must live with him/her.
ssw: umntfwanalonakekelwako kufuneka abe neminyaka lengaphasi kwe18 budzala.

eng: the recipient must meet the requirements of the means test (income test).
ssw: lotfola sibonelelo sesondlo semntfwana kufuneka abe ngumnakekeli wekucala futsi abe ahlala naye lomntfwana.

eng: if the primary caregiver is single (never married, divorced or widowed), his/ her income cannot be more than r4 800 per month.
ssw: lotfola sibonelelo seso ndlo semntfwana kufuneka ahambisane netidzingo teluhlolo (luhlolo lwemali yemholo).

eng: if the primary caregiver is married, the combined income of the applicant and his/her spouse cannot be more than r9 600 per month.
ssw: uma ngabe umnakekeli wekucala angakashadi (angakate ashade, ahlukene nemlingani noma ashonelwe ngumlingani), imali layiholako ingengci kur4 800 ngenyanga.

eng: our nation mourns the young lives lost in enyobeni tavern tragedy vukuzenzele unnamed a few weeks ago the families of a township in scenery park outside east london, received news that every parent prays they never get to hear.
ssw: sive setfu sililela kulahleka kwetimphilo letincane engotini yasetjwaleni enyobeni sihle manda emavikini lambalwa lengcile imindeni yaselokishini lasescenery park eeast london, itfole tindzaba wonkhe umtali lathandazela kutsi angativa.

eng: they were told that 21 of their children had been found dead, in a tavern.
ssw: batjelwe kutsi bantfwana babo labange21 batfolakale bashonile, ethaveni.

eng: the youngest child was only 13 years old.
ssw: umntfwana lomncane kakhulu labelapho bekaneminyaka le13 budzala.

eng: the police investigation into the tragedy is proceeding apace.
ssw: luphenyo lwemaphoyisa lwalengoti luchubeka ngekushesha.

eng: flowing from the investigations, the buffalo city metro is looking into whether the tavern violated any municipal regulations.
ssw: ngemphumela waloluphenya, masipala wasedolobhenikati ibuffalo ubuka kutsi lethaveni ngabe ayikayephuli yini imitsetfosimiso yamasipala.

eng: our thoughts and prayers are with the families who are struggling to come to terms with this unspeakable horror.
ssw: emicabangweni yetfu kanye nasemithandazweni yetfu sikhumbula lemindeni lebukene nalolusizi lolungaka lolungakhulumeki.

eng: we commend the eastern cape provincial government for assisting the affected families, as well as avbob that has pledged to assist the families with the burials.
ssw: siyamncoma hulumende wesifundza sasemphumalanga kapa ngekusita lemindeni levelelwe ngulengoti, kanye naavbob lotsembise kutsi utawusita lemindeni ngekubangcwabela.

eng: even as the relevant authorities deconstruct what happened to ensure there is justice for the victims, there is a conversation we do need to have as a country.
ssw: ngisho nome ngabe tiphatsimandla tingalinga kuhlanganisa kutsi kwentekeni kute kutsi kube nebulungiswa kulabo labavelelwe ngulengoti, kusanenkhulumo lekumele kutsi sibenayo njengelive.

eng: it is the problem of underage drinking.
ssw: yindzaba yenkinga yekunatsa tjwala kwebantfwana labasebancane.

eng: the footage and images posted online of the socalled ‘pens down’ party at the venue that night show revelling youngsters clutching bottles of alcohol.
ssw: titfombe nemifanekiso letfunyelwe etinkhundleni tekuchumana yelidzili lelatiwa ngekutsi ‘kubeka phasi emapeni’ kuleyo ndzawo ebusuku kubonakala bantfu labasha batijabulisa babambe emabhodlela etjwala.

eng: many of those in the images look barely out of their teens.
ssw: bonkhe labalapho kuletitfombe babukeka basengakaphumi ekubeni ngemabhobhodlelana netidzandzane.

eng: a number of young people from scenery park have told the media of having seen a post circulated on social media, offering free rounds of alcohol to all who attended the event that night.
ssw: linyenti lebantfu labasha basescenery park batjele betindzaba kutsi bona babone tatiso etinkhundleni tekuchumana, lebetikhangisa ngekutfolakala kwetjwala bamahhala kubo bonkhe labatawuhambela lomcimbi ngalobo busuku.

eng: the increased social acceptability of young people drinking alcohol has become a serious problem in a country where the majority of the drinking population are already classified by the world health organization as binge drinkers.
ssw: kukhula kwekuvumeleka emmangweni kwebantfu kutsi banatse tjwala sekugucuke kwaba yinkinga lenkhulu kulelive lapho khona linyenti lebantfu labanatsako sevele batsatfwa njengetidzakwa yinhlangano yemhlaba yetemphilo.

eng: alcohol use amongst adolescents is associated with impaired function, absenteeism from learning, alcoholrelated injuries, suicidal thoughts and attempts, and risky behaviour.
ssw: kunatswa kwetjwala lusha kubanga kutsi kube nekungasebenti kahle, nekuphutselwa kuya esikolweni, netingoti letiphatselene netjwala, nemicabango yekutibulala nekulinga kutibulala, kanye nekutiphatsa ngendlela lenebungoti.

eng: we must come together to combat this vice that is robbing our young people of the best years of their lives, and making them susceptible to alcohol addiction.
ssw: kufanele kutsi sihlangane silwe nalesihlava lesibulala likusasa lebantfu labasha kanye neminyaka yabo lemihle yekuphila, lesibenta kutsi babe tigcila tetjwala.

eng: as families it means having open and frank conversations about alcohol and setting boundaries.
ssw: njengemindeni kufanele kutsi sibe netinkhulumiswano letivulekile letimayelana netjwala futsi sibeke imikhawulo.

eng: children under the age of 18 consuming alcohol is against the law.
ssw: akukho emtsetfweni kunatsa kwebantfwana labangephasi kweminyaka le18.

eng: as adults we should refrain from practices such as sending minors to buy alcohol for us or capitulating to requests to buy these young people alcohol.
ssw: njengebantfu labadzala kufanele kutsi siyiyekele lemikhuba yekutfuma bantfwana kutsi bayositsengela tjwala noma yekuvuma uma basicela kutsi sibatsengele tjwala.

eng: it is not the first time we have been confronted with tragic events such as what happened in scenery park last week.
ssw: akusiko kwekucala kutsi sihlangabetane nesehlakalo letibuhlungu lesifana nalesi lesenteke escenery park kuleliviki leliphelile.

eng: a common denominator between enyobeni tavern, the throb nightclub disaster in durban in 2000, and the osi’s tavern tragedy in khayelitsha in 2015, is that these establishments were selling liquor to minors.
ssw: intfo lebonakala kuto tonkhe letehlakalo sasethaveni yasenyobeni, senhlekelele yasendzaweni yekutijabulisa yasebusuku ethrob edurban ngemnyaka we2000, kanye nasethaveni yaseosi ekhayelitsha ngemnyaka we2015, ngukutsi tonkhe letindzawo betitsengisela bantfwana labancane tjwala.

eng: the proliferation of establishments openly flouting the law points to failings on the part of authorities to enforce regulations.
ssw: kuchubeka kwetindzawo tephule imitsetfo kukhombisa kutsi tiphatsimandla tiyehluleka kugcina kulandzelwa kwemtsetfo.

eng: under the national liquor act, owners of establishments with liquor licenses may not sell alcohol to anyone under the age of 18. they must also take reasonable steps to ensure anyone they are selling alcohol to is of age.
ssw: ngekwemtsetfo wavelonkhe wetjwala, banikati betindzawo letinetimvume tekutsengisa tjwala abakavunyelwa kutsi batsengisele nome ngabe ngubani loneminyaka lengephasi kwe18.

eng: we call on communities to work with authorities to ensure that taverns, shebeens, entertainment venues and outlets breaking the law face the consequences.
ssw: kufanele kutsi batsatse tinyatselo letivakalako kucinisekisa kutsi nome ngabe ngubani labamtsengisela tjwala mdzala.

eng: we call upon our police to step up the enforcement of laws that prohibit the sale of alcohol close to schools and enhance monitoring of outlets to ensure alcohol is not being sold to minors.
ssw: sicela yonkhe imimmango kutsi isebentisane netiphatsimandla kucinisekisa kutsi emathaveni, emashibhini, tindzawo tekucedza situnge kanye netekutijabulisa letephula umtsetfo tiyajeziswa.

eng: another reality is that alcohol is a form of escapism for young people in communities were opportunities for safe and ageappropriate recreation are few.
ssw: sicela emaphoyisa etfu kutsi aphakamise kugcinwa kwemtsetfo lovimbela kutsengiswa kwetjwala edvute netikolo futsi ente kutsi kube nekucashelwa kwaleto tindzawo kute kucinisekiswe kutsi tjwala abutsengiselwa bantfwana.

eng: in the wake of the tragedy, the community has pointed out that there are no viable sports grounds, community libraries or youth centres in scenery park.
ssw: lenye intfo leliciniso kutsi tjwala buyindlela yekubalekela liciniso lemphilo yebantfu labasha emimmangweni lapho khona kute tindzawo letiphephile netekukhibika letihambisana neminyaka yabo.

eng: as government at national, provincial and local level we need to respond to the pleas of this community and those of other communities by developing more recreational spaces, facilities, programmes, and projects for our young people in disadvantaged areas in the province.
ssw: ummango wasescenery park ubale kweswelakala kwemidlalo, kwetinsita tekufundza kanye naletinye tinsita tekutfutfukisa bantfu labasha, njengesizatfu lesibaholela kutsi ‘bagijimele emathaveni.’ ngemva kwalengoti, ummango utsite kute tinkhundla tekudlala, imitapomabhuku yemmango nome tikhungo telusha lapha escenery park.

eng: as communities we must work with our community policing forums, with our civics organisations and with our school governing bodies and play a more active role in the lives of our children and in ensuring their safety and wellbeing.
ssw: njengahulumende ezingeni lavelonkhe, lesifundza nasezingeni lahulumende wendzawo kufuneka kutsi siphendvule kuleticelosikhalo talommango kanye netaleminye imimmango ngekutsi sisungule tindzawo tekukhibika letinyenti, tinsita, tinhlelo, kanye nemiklamo yelusha lwetfu kuletindzawo lebetincishwe ematfuba kulesifundza.

eng: as they say in our african indigenous classics "it takes a community to raise a child".
ssw: labanye balingani betfu kutenhlalo labafana nabosomabhizinisi bemmango kufuneka kutsi basisite ngeminikelo.

eng: let us work together to protect our precious future generation from the ravages of alcohol and drug abuse and their effects.
ssw: njengemimango kufanele kutsi sisebentisane netinkhundla temmango temaphoyisa, netinhlangano tetfu temmango kanye nemikhandlu lephetse tikolo kutsi sidlale indzima kakhulu etimphilweni tebantfwana betfu kanye nasekucinisekiseni kuphepha kanye nenhlalakahle yabo.

eng: monkeypox in south africa vukuzenzele unnamed health health minister dr joe phaahla has confirmed that monkeypox has been detected in south africa during a recent media briefing in pretoria, gauteng.
ssw: incubulunjane yetingobiyane (imonkeypox) eningizimu afrika vukuzenzele unnamed indvuna yetemphi lo dkt.

eng: he said he received a report from the national health laboratory services (nhls) that they have confirmed monkeypox in south africa through laboratory tests.
ssw: joe phaahla ucinisekisile kutsi lencubulunjaneyetingo biyane seyitfolakele lapha eningizimu afrika ngesikhatsi acocisana kungasikudzala nebeti ndzaba epitoli, egauteng.

eng: the virus has been detected in gauteng and the western cape.
ssw: utsite utfole umbiko lovela enational health laboratory services (inhls) kutsi bakucinisekisile kubakhona kwelencubulunjane yetingobiyane lapha eningizimu afrika ngekusebentisa luhlolo lwaselabhorethri.

eng: monkeypox is usually a mild disease manifesting as blisters or sores on the skin.
ssw: leligciwane selitfolakele egauteng nasenshonalanga kapa.

eng: it is usually mild and with a fatality rate of 1 percent.
ssw: lencubulunjane ivamise kuba sifo lesibonakala kancane ngetilondza nome tinshabusuku esikhu mbeni.

eng: the disease has previously been reported in african countries such as nigeria, democratic republic of the congo, central african republic and ghana in the early 2000s.
ssw: lesifo sesike sabikwa emaveni aseafrika lafana nenigeria, eriphabhliki yentsandvo yelinyenti yasecongo, central african republic naseghana ekuca leni kweminyaka yabo2000.

eng: the current outbreak is dominated by high numbers in europe with the uk leading with over 700 cases, spain with just over 500, followed by germany, portugal and france.
ssw: lokubhedvuka kwanyalo kubonakala kunemazinga lasetulu eyurophu lapho kuhamba khona embili iuk ngetehlakalo letingetulu kwe700, bese kutsi spain sona sibe nje ngetulu kwe500, kulandzele lasejalimani, laseportugal nefrance.

eng: the minister said the national institute for communicable diseases (nicd) is conducting online inservice training for health workers to be able to detect the disease so that necessary laboratory tests can be done.
ssw: indvuna itsite sikhungo savelonkhe setifo letitsa tselanako (inicd) ichuba tifundvo tekusebenta ufundza ngeinthanethi kutisebenti tetemphilo kute tikhone kusibona lesifo kute kwentiwe luhlolo lwaselabhorethri loludzingekile.

eng: "the disease only spreads through close contact, so you cannot get it by being in the same room with an infected person," the minister said.
ssw: "lesifo sibhebhetseka kuphela nakube nekutsi ntsana edvute, ngakoke ngeke usitfole ngekutsi ube sekamelweni linye nemuntfu losuleleke ngaso," kwasho indvuna.

eng: minister phaahla assu red south africans that monkeypox is not a virus which has never been seen before and scientists have information about it.
ssw: indvuna phaahla ucinisekise bantfu baseningizimu afrika kutsi lencubulu njane ayisilo ligciwane lelingazange selibonwe ngaphambilini futsi bososayensi banelwatiso ngalo.

eng: chairperson of the minis terial advisory committee (mac) on covid19 and executive member of nhls, professor koleka mlisana, said monkeypox is a disease that is endemic in central and northern africa which has been known to be mild.
ssw: sihlalo welikomidi letindvuna lekweluleka (imac) mayelana necovid19 kanye nelilunga lesigungu senhls, solwati koleka mlisana, utsite lencubulunjane ingubhubhane wesigodzi lotfolakala esigodzini sasecentral nasenyakatfo afrika leyatiwa njengale ngenamandla kangako.

eng: an endemic disease is a condition regularly found among particular people or in a certain area.
ssw: lesifo sivamise kutfolakala esigodzini lesitsite emkha tsini kwebantfu labatsite nome endzaweni letsite.

eng: she said there are simila rities between monkeypox and smallpox.
ssw: utsite kunekufanana kwetimphawu emkhatsi ni kwalencubulunjane yetingobiyane kanye nencubulunjane leyatiwa ngesmallpox.

eng: "there are vaccines and treatment available for monkeypox.
ssw: "kunemitsi kanye nekwelashwa lokukhona kwelencubulunjane yetingobiyane.

eng: the disease presents itself with flu like symptoms and legionnaires.
ssw: lesifo sitiveta ngetimphawu letifana neimfuluwenza kanye netesifo selegionnaires.

eng: the important thing is that somebody who comes up with a clinical picture is easy to diagnose and most importantly it is difficult to transmit, unlike a respiratory virus, because it is by contact.
ssw: lokumcoka kutsi umuntfu lovela nendlela tsite yetekwelashwa kulula kumcilonga futsi lokubaluleke kakhulu kutsi kulukhuni kutsi sendluliseleke, asifani neligciwane lekuphefumula, ngobe sisuleleka ngekutsintsana.

eng: you would only get it when you have come in direct contact with somebody who is infected," she said.
ssw: usitfola kuphela nangabe utsintsane nemuntfu lonaso," kwasho mlisana.

eng: legionnaires' disease is a severe form of pneumonia.
ssw: sifo selegionnaires siluhlobo lwenyumoniya lenemandla kakhulu.

eng: professor mlisana said contact tracing is important in this case and the health department will continue to do that.
ssw: solwati mlisana utsite kulandzelela labo labatsi ntsene kubalulekile kuloku kantsi litiko letemphilo litawuchubeka likwente loko.

eng: she assured south africans that the laboratory infrastructure has all the adequate resources to be able monitor any new infections that may arise.
ssw: ucinisekise bantfu baseningizimu afrika kutsi sakhiwonchanti sasela bhorethri sinato tonkhe tinsita letingakhona kugadza nome ngabe ngukuphi kutseleleka lokusha lokungahle kube khona.

eng: "through her training agency, dr zulu explained that she worked across six provinces, helping women and young people to run their farming operations.
ssw: usebentisa lwati lwakhe lolujulile lwekudla lokunemsoco kanye neminyaka yekukhicita tinkhukhu netibhidvo ngekwemvelo epulazini lakhe ngenhloso yekutfutfukisa labanye bomake kute kutsi babe balimi labalimela kutsengisa.

eng: commercial poultry farmingin 2017, dr zulu realised that her training was meaningless without results, so she bought a farm to put her knowledge into action.
ssw: zulu (48), loneticu tebudokotela kutekudla lokunemsoco unelipulazi lelingemahektha lange23 ecullinan ngaphandle kwepitoli, lapho akhicita khona ngekwemvelo tibhidvo netinkhukhu ngekusebenta imikhicito ngekulima layiphakela etimakethe letinyenti.

eng: today, she has become a commercial poultry farmer with more than 7 500 broilers.
ssw: lipulazi lakhe liphindze futsi lisingatse titjudeni letinge20 leticeceshelwa tifundvo tekulima.

eng: south africa's first female paratrooper dr ethel zulu is leading from the front on her farm where she grows organic vegetables and freerange chickens she supplies to the established supermarkets.
ssw: zulu wayekela umsebenti wakhe elitikweni letekulima enyakatfo nshonalanga kute acale iejensi yakhe yekucecesha leyatiwa ngekutsi yihope nutrition business consultants.

eng: she uses chicken manure to grow vegetables such as spinach, broccoli, cabbage and peppers.
ssw: unelutsandvo lolukhulu lwetekulima kantsi umbononchanti wakhe kutsi kungene bomake labanyenti kutekulima, lokungumkhakha lakholelwa ekutseni unemandla lagcinekile ekutfutfukisa nekudala imisebenti.

eng: small business urged to apply for support nosihle shelembe the minister of small business development, stella ndabeniabra hams, has encouraged small businesses in townships and rural areas to apply for support through the township and rural entrepreneurship programme (trep).
ssw: emabhizinisi lamancane ayagcugcutelwa kutsi afake ticelo tekusekelwa nosihle shelembe indvuna yetekutfu tfukisa emabhizinisi lamancane, stella ndabeniabrahams, ugcugcutele emabhizinisi lamancane emalokishini nasetindzaweni tasema khaya kutsi afake ticelo tekwesekelwa ngekusebentisa luhlelo lwete mabhizinisi asemalokishi nasetindzaweni tasemakhaya (itrep).

eng: "we are deliberate in addressing unemployment and poverty, but we also have a responsibility to grow the economy," minister ndabeni abrahams said.
ssw: "sikwenta ngenhloso kutsi silungise kuswelakala kwemisebenti nebuphuya, siphindze futsi sibe nesibopho sekutsi sikhulise umnotfo," kwasho yona njalo indvuna ndabeniabrahams.

eng: addressing the shetradesza youth seminar held recently in pretoria, the minister said the maximum value of trep stands at r1 million, with one com ponent being a grant and the other a loan.
ssw: ngesikhatsi akhuluma emhlanganweni welusha weshetradesza lesandza kubanjelwa lapha epitoli, indvuna itsite samba lesikhulu semalimboleko setrep sibe esigidzini semarandi lesinye, incenye yinye iba sibonelomali bese kutsi lenye incenye ibe imalimboleko.

eng: township or ruralbased entrepreneurs can apply for support, including funding, through the common application template from the small enterprise development agency (seda), the small enterprise finance agency (sefa), the national empowerment fund (nef) and the national youth development agency (nyda).
ssw: bosomabhizinisi labasetindzaweni tasemakhaya nome emalokishini bangafaka sicelo sekwesekelwa, lokufaka ekhatsi kusekelwa ngetimali, ngekusebentisa lifomu leleteyalekile lelibuya kuejensi yekutfutfukisa emabhizinisi lamancane (iseda), iejensi yetetimali yemabhizinisi lamancane (isefa), iejensi yesikhwa ma savelonkhe sekutfutfu kisa (inef) kanye neejensi yavelonkhe yekutfutfukisa lusha (inyda).

eng: the owners of the business must be south african nationals.
ssw: banikati bemabhizinisi kufanele kutsi babe takhamuti taseningizimu afrika.

eng: the following schemes are available for qualifying entrepreneurs: smallscale bakeries and confectioneries support programme autobody repairs and mechanics support programme (as well as small and independent autospares shops and informal automotive entrepreneurs) butcheries support programme clothing, leather and textiles support programme personal care support programme spazashop support programme tshisanyama and cooked food support programme registration can be done on smmesa.
ssw: letikimi letilandzelako tiyatfolakala kulabo bosomabhizinisi labafanelekako: luhlelo lwekwesekela babhaki betinkhwa nemakhekhe luhlelo lwekusekela kulungiswa kwetimoto kanye netitolo letitsengisa tincenye tetimoto neku khinika timoto (kanye netitolo letincane tetincenye tetimoto naletitimele kanye nabosomabhizinisi betimoto labatimele).

eng: gov.
ssw: gov.

eng: and complete the information required.
ssw: za bese uce dzela lwatiso loludzinge kako.

eng: in an effort to ensure the funding processes for small business is seamless and userfriendly, government is working toward merging entities for small businesses to form one agency.
ssw: kucinisekisa kutsi tinchubo tekutfola timali temabhizinisi lamancane kwenteka ngaphandle kwetihibe futsi kwenteka lula, hulumende umatasatasa ngekuhlanganisa ndzawonye tikhungo temabhizinisi lamancane kutsi akhe iejensi yinye.

eng: "we are currently in the process of merging sefa and seda as well as the cooperative banks development agency.
ssw: "kwanyalo simatasatasa ngenchubo yekuhlanganisa isefa neseda kanye neejensi yekutfutfukisa emabhange lasebentisanako.

eng: "shetrades programme ndabeniabrahams said through various initiatives, government has assisted the small business sector to grow and create muchneeded employment.
ssw: "luhlelo lweshetrades ndabeniabrahams utsite ngekusebentisa imitamo leyehlukahlukene, hulumende usite umkhakha wetemabhizinisi lamancane kutsi ukhule futsi udale kucasheka lokudzingeka kakhulu.

eng: "the department of small business development and seda formed a partnership with the international trade centre (itc), to bring the shetrades programme to south africa, and create a shetradesza hub.
ssw: "litiko letekutfutfukisa emabhizinisi lamancane neseda bakhe budle lwane nesikhungo semave emhlaba sekuhweba (iitc), kute kutsi kuletfwe loluhlelo lweshetrades lapha eningizimu afrika kanye nekudala kutsi kube nenkhaba yeshetradesza.

eng: we can and will do more to end load shedding vukuzenzele unnamed over the past few weeks, severe load shedding has disrupted our economy and caused extreme hardship for all south africans.
ssw: singakhona futsi sitawusebenta ngemandla kute sicedze kucishwa kwagezi vukuzenzele unnamed kulamaviki lamba lwa lengcile, ku cishwa kwakhulu kwagezi ngenhloso yekuwonga kutsikamete u mnotfo wetfu futsi kwa banga bulukhuni lobu khulu kubantfu bonkhe baseningizimu afrika.

eng: stage 6 load shedding was triggered by the loss of more than 18 000 megawatts (mw) of generation capacity due to unit breakdowns and an unprotected strike by eskom workers.
ssw: sigaba se6 sekucishwa kwagezi ngenhloso yekuwonga kwabangelwa kulahleka kwemamegawatts (emamw) langetulu kwe18 000 emandla ekuphehla ngenca yekwephuka kwemayunithi kanye nesiteleka sebasebenti bakaeskom lesingekho emtsetfweni.

eng: after more than a decade of electricity shortages, south africans are right to feel frustrated and angry.
ssw: ngemuva kweminyaka lelishumi kunekushoda kwagezi, bantfu baseningizimu afrika bafanele kutfukutsela nekukhatsateka.

eng: at times like this, it can feel like there is no end in sight.
ssw: ngetikhatsi letifanana naleti, kuvakala shengatsi lentfo ngeke ite iphele nyalo nanyalo.

eng: yet, while load shedding appears to worsen, the reality is that we have already taken several important actions to address the shortfall in electricity supply.
ssw: nanome kucishwa kwagezi ngenhloso yekuwonga kubonakala shengatsi sekubi kakhulu, liciniso litsi sesitsatse tincumo letinyenti naletibalulekile tekulungisa lokushoda kwekuphakelwa kwagezi.

eng: our immediate priority is to stabilise the electricity system.
ssw: lesikubeke embili lesitawucala ngako kutsi sikwente, kusimamisa luhlelo lwekuphakelwa kwagezi.

eng: as the system recovers and generation capacity is restored, eskom will be able to reduce load shedding to lower stages.
ssw: njengaloku loluhlelo seluvuka nekuphehlwa kwagezi sekubuyela esimeni, eskom utawukhona kutsi anciphise kucishwa kwagezi ngenhloso yekuwonga kube setigabeni letiphasi.

eng: the agreement reached between eskom and labour unions will enable critical repairs and return additional units to operation.
ssw: lesivumelwane lokufinyelelwe kuso emkhatsini waeskom netinyonyana tebasebenti sitakwenta kutsi kukhonwe kulungisa loko lokumcoka kanye nekubuyisela esimeni kusebenta kwemayunithi langentiwe.

eng: the transmission line from cahora bassa in mozambique has been restored, adding 600 mw to the grid, and medupi unit 6 returned to service recently adding another 720 mw.
ssw: kuhanjiswa kwagezi lokusuka ecohora bassa emazambiki sekubuyiselwe esimeni futsi, lokwenta kutsi kungenteke 600 mw kugridi kanye neyunithi ye6 yasemedupi seyiyasebenta kusukela ngemgcibelo, lokukwengete lamanye ema720 mw.

eng: additional units are expected to come back online, further easing the current shortfall.
ssw: emayunithi langentiwe kulindzeleke kutsi asebente futsi, lokuyintfo letakwehlisa kakhulu umtfwalo wekushoda kwagezi lokukhona kwanyalo.

eng: at the same time, law enforcement agencies are working hard to tackle sabotage, theft and fraud at eskom to address the threat that these criminal actions pose to the electricity system.
ssw: ngesikhatsi lesifanako, emaejensi ekucinisekisa kugcinwa kwemtsetfo asebenta kamatima ekulweni nekucekelwa phasi, kweba nekukhwabanisa lokwenteka kaeskom ngenhloso yekulungisa lobungoti eluhlelweni lwagezi lobubangwa nguletento tebugebengu.

eng: in the end, the bottom line is that we need to add more capacity to the grid.
ssw: ekugcineni, lokumcoka kutsi sidzinga kutsi singete kakhulu likhono lekwenta kugridi.

eng: this will create space for eskom to undertake critical maintenance and increase the reliability of its fleet.
ssw: loku kutawudala kutsi eskom akhone kutsi atfole litfuba lekugcineka asesimeni lesibalulekile lesisebentako kanye nekwandzisa kwetsembeka kwetisetjentiswa takhe.

eng: it will also create a buffer so that even if several units experience breakdowns at once, other sources can be used.
ssw: loko kutawuphindza futsi kwakhe sivikelo sekutsi nanome emayunithi lamanyenti angephuka ngesikhatsi sinye, leminye imitfombolusito ingasetjentiswa.

eng: one of the first steps i took in 2018 was to revive the renewable energy procurement programme.
ssw: lesinye setinyatselo lengasitsatsa ngemnyaka wa2018 kwaba kuvusetela luhlelo lwekutsenga emandla lavusetelelwako.

eng: in addition to the procurement of new generation capacity through this programme, the increase of the licensing threshold for new generation projects to 100 mw means that private investors do not require a license to build generation facilities up to this size.
ssw: kwengeta kulokutsengwa kwemandla lamasha ekuphehla ngekusebentisa loluhlelo, kwenyuka kwemkhawulo wemvume yemiklamo yekuphehla kwafinyelela kuma100 mw kusho kutsi batjalitimali labatimele imvume kute bakhe tisetjentiswa kute tifinyelele kulobungaka.

eng: this simple reform has unlocked a massive potential pipeline of investment.
ssw: letingucuko letilula tivule emandla lamakhulu labegcinekile letako elutjalomali.

eng: eskom has made land available next to existing power stations for private investment in renewable energy projects.
ssw: eskom wente kutsi kube nemhlaba edvute netiteshi takhe temandla kute kutsi kube nelutjalomali lolutimele kumiklamo yemandla lavusetelelwako.

eng: design modifications have been completed to improve the performance of medupi units 1, 2 and 3 and are underway in units 5 and 6. while these actions are significant and will bear fruit over the coming months, they are clearly not enough to address the crisis that we face.
ssw: tindlela temadizayini setivele tiphotfuliwe kute kutsi kwentiwe ncono kusebenta kwemayunithi 1, 2 na3 asemedupi kantsi asachubeka kumayunithi 5 na6.

eng: what the past few weeks have demonstrated is that we need to do more and do so with the utmost urgency.
ssw: nanome lolokwentiwako kubalulekile futsi kutawutsela titselo kuletinyanga letitako, akukaneli kutsi kulungiseke lenkinga lesibukene nayo.

eng: over the past few weeks, we have been working with the relevant ministers and senior officials on a range of additional measures to accelerate all efforts to increase our electricity supply.
ssw: lokukhonjiswe ngulamaviki lambalwa lengcile kutsi sidzinga kutsi sente kakhulu futsi loko sikwente ngekuphutfuma.

eng: the message is clear: this is no time for business as usual.
ssw: umlayeto uyacaca: lesi akusiso sikhatsi sekusebenta njengalokwetayelekile.

eng: we need to act boldly to make load shedding a thing of the past.
ssw: kudzingeka kutsi sitsatse sincumo ngesibindzi kute sente kucishwa kwegezi ngenhloso yekuwonga kube yintfo yasesikhatsi lesengca.

eng: while the measures we have already taken will secure the supply of reliable and affordable electricity into the future, we have been looking at what additional measures we can take now to bring that goal closer.
ssw: nanome letinyatselo lesesititsatsile titawukwenta siciniseko sekutsi kuphakelwa ngekwetsembeka nekungabiti kwagezi esikhatsini lesitako, sesibuke kutsi ngutiphi letinye tinyatselo lesingatitsatsa nyalo kute kutsi sisondzete edvute leyo nhloso yetfu.

eng: we will soon be completing the detailed work and consultations needed to finalise these further measures.
ssw: kungasikudzala sitawucedzisa umsebenti ngemininingwane kanye nekubonisana lokudzingekile kute siphotfule letinyatselo letichubekako.

eng: we will then, soon, be able to announce a comprehensive set of actions to achieve much faster progress in tackling load shedding.
ssw: sitawubeseke, ngekushesha, sesiyakhona kumemetela tinyatselo letiphelele kute sizuze inchubekelembili ngekushesha ekulweni nalenkinga yekucishwa kwagezi ngenhloso yekuwonga.

eng: we must act now and together to end violence against women vukuzenzele unnamed it has been a tragic start to women’s month.
ssw: kufuneka sente lokutsite nyalo futsi sibambisane kucedza ludlame lolucondziswe kubomake vukuzenzele unnamed icale ngendlela lebuhlungu inyanga yabomake.

eng: we are once more confronted with the dark and ugly side of our society.
ssw: sesiphindze sabukana nebumnyama lobubi emmangweni wetfu.

eng: last month, a group of men and women shooting a music video at a disused mine near krugersdorp were attacked by armed assailants who gang raped eight of the women.
ssw: kulenyanga leyengcile, licembu lemadvodza kanye nelabomake lebebatsatsa titfombe tevidiyo yemculo endzaweni leyimayini lengasasebenti edvute nase krugersdorp bahlaselwa bahlaseli labebahlomile lebahlanganyela badlengula bomake labasiphohlongo.

eng: these horrible acts of brutality are an affront to the right of women and girls to live and work in freedom and safety.
ssw: letentfo letimbi telunya tibukela phasi emalungelo abomake nemantfomba tane tekutsi baphile futsi basebente ngekukhululeka nangendlela levikelekile.

eng: while they pursue the suspects in this crime, the south african police service must also pay immediate attention to the concerns of the community of west village, where the incident occurred, who say they are under siege from armed gangs in the area.
ssw: luphiko lemaphoyisa ase ningizimu afrika kufuneka lunake letikhalo temma ngo wasewest village, lapho lesigameko senteke khona, lotsi ungaphasi kwekuvinjetelwa macembu emagenge lahlomile laku lendzawo.

eng: rapists have no place in our society.
ssw: badlenguli abanayo indzawo emangweni wetfu.

eng: we call upon communities to work with the police to ensure that these criminals are apprehended and prosecuted.
ssw: senta lubito kumimango kutsi isebentisane nema phoyisa kucinisekisa kutsi letigebengu tiyaboshwa bese tiyashushiswa.

eng: our communities must not shelter criminals in their midst.
ssw: imimango yetfu akufuneki ifihle tigebengu letisemkha tsini kwayo.

eng: there is always someone in our communities who knows something, who heard something or who even witnessed something.
ssw: ngaso sonkhe sikha tsi kukhona umuntfu emangweni wetfu lowati lokutsite, love lokutsite noma lobone lokutsite.

eng: the problem is many of us choose to keep quiet because the perpetrator is a friend, a partner or a colleague.
ssw: inkhinga kutsi linyenti letfu likhetsa kubindza ngoba lolobhebhetsekisa ludlame ungumngani, umlingani noma umuntfu lesisebenta naye.

eng: or we are just afraid and fear victimisation.
ssw: noma simane siyasaba kutsi sitawentakaliswa.

eng: it is important to remember that all tipoffs received by the saps crime stop contact centre are treated confidentiality.
ssw: ku mcoka kukhumbula kutsi onkhe emathiphu latfolwe sikhungo sekulwa nebu gebengu sesaps agcinwa ayimfihlo.

eng: i call on anyone who has information about this crime to report it to the authorities so the perpetrators can be arrested.
ssw: ngicela wonkhe umuntfu lonelwatiso mayelana nalelicala kutsi alibike kubaphatsi kute kuboshwe labo labagangile.

eng: given the size of this problem in our country, it is no longer possible to avoid responsibility for reporting sex crimes.
ssw: ngenca yekukhula kwa lenkhinga kulelive lakitsi, akusakhonakali kutsi singawunaki umsebenti wetfu wekubika emacala lamayelana netemacansi.

eng: according to a new legal provision that has come into effect, in addition to our moral obligation, we all now have a legal duty to report to authorities when we have knowledge, reasonable belief or suspicion that a sexual offence has been committed against a vulnerable person.
ssw: ngekuya kwetibonelelo temtsetfo letisandza kucala kusebenta, letingeta kulokutibophelela kwe kutiphatsa kwetfu, nyalo sonkhe sinemsebenti losemtsetfweni wekubika kubaphatsi uma sinelwa tiso, sinenkholelo noma sinetinsolo letivakalako tekutsi kunelicala letema cansi lelentiwe lelibhekiswe emuntfwini lobutsakatsaka.

eng: it is now a crime not to report such a sexual offence.
ssw: nyalo sekulicala kungabiki lolo luhlobo lelicala letema cansi.

eng: this is part of one of three laws that i signed earlier this year that strengthen the fight against genderbased violence and offer greater support and protection to survivors.
ssw: lena ngulenye incenye yemitsetfo lemitsatfu lephasiswe ekucaleni kwa lomnyaka lekhulisa kulwa neludlame lwetebulili futsi lenika kusekela lokukhulu nekuvikeleka kulabo labasindzile kulokuhluku meteka.

eng: among other things, the laws expand the scope of the national register of sex offenders, strengthen the vetting process, and introduce additional categories of sex offences.
ssw: kulokunye, lemitse tfo ikhulisa lobubanti berejista yavelonkhe yetephulamtsetfo tema cala etemacansi, ikhulisa lenchubo yekuhlola tephu lamtsetfo, kanye nekufaka letinye tinhlobo temacala etemacansi.

eng: processes are underway to put these laws into effect.
ssw: tinchubo tekwenta lemitsetfo kutsi isebente tisendleleni.

eng: these include training of prosecutors and magistrates, issuing directives on bail to all saps officials, and revising charge sheets to include the newly created offences.
ssw: loku kufaka kuceceshwa kwebashu shisi nabomantji, kunika bonkhe basebenti besaps ticondziso tekunika ibhe yili, kanye nekubuyeketa kweluhlu lwemacala kute akhone kufaka emacala lamasha lasandza kusu ngulwa.

eng: we are determined that all these building blocks are in place so that our law enforcement authorities and courts can investigate and prosecute genderbased violence more effectively.
ssw: siyatsemba kakhulu kutsi tonkhe letindlela time ngemumo kute basebenti bakitsi betemtsetfo neti nkhantolo bakhone kuphenya futsi bashushise ngemphumelelo lenkhulu emacala lamayelana nelu dlame lwetebulili.

eng: genderbased violence and femicide is a deeprooted societal problem.
ssw: ludlame lolubhekiswe kubulili lobutsite neku bulawa kwabomake kuyinkhinga lenkhulu lejule netimbandze emimangweni yetfu.

eng: it is not enough for perpetrators to be apprehended, tried, convicted and sentenced.
ssw: akukaneli kutsi labo labalubhebhetselisako baboshwe, bashushiswe, balahlwe licala bese baya gwetjwa.

eng: we must work together to address the drivers of genderbased violence in our communities, including patriarchal attitudes and practices.
ssw: kufuneka sisebentisane kute sibukane naloko loku banga ludlame lwetebulili emimangweni yetfu, lefaka ekhatsi indlela yekutiphatsa kanye nalenemikhuba leyenta emadvodza abukele phasi labasikati.

eng: eradicating genderbased violence demands that we act together as a people.
ssw: kucedza ludlame lwe tebulili kudzinga kutsi sisebentisane sibantfu.

eng: this means promoting positive attitudes around gender equality in our communities, at our places of worship and in our own homes.
ssw: loku kusho kutsi kufu neka sigcugcutele tindlela tekutiphatsa letikahle mayelana nekulingana kutebulili emimangweni, emasontfweni kanye nasemakhaya etfu.

eng: as men, we should demonstrate our intolerance to sexism, patriarchy and genderbased violence in how we treat our partners, colleagues, mothers, sisters and daughters.
ssw: nje ngemadvodza, kufuneka sikhombise kungakuvumeli kubandlulula ngekwebulili, singawuvumeli umcondvo wekubukela phasi labasi kati kanye neludlame lolumayelana netebulili ngendlela lesiphatsa ngayo balingani betfu, labo lesise benta nabo, bomake, bosesi kanye nemadvodzakati etfu.

eng: whether as individuals, organisations, businesses or employers, we must be part of the national effort in every way we can, whether volunteering at a shelter, supporting community policing forums or joining awareness campaigns in our schools.
ssw: kungaba muntfu nga munye, noma tinhlangano, emabhizinisi noma bacashi, kufuneka sibe yincenye yemitamo yavelonkhe ngayo yonkhe indlela lesingakhona ngayo, kungaba kuvolontiya esikhungweni sekuhlalisa labaswele, singasekela emacembu emmango lasebentisana nemaphoyisa noma ngekuhlanganyela kumikhankaso yemicimbi letsite etikolweni takitsi.

eng: just as genderbased violence is all of society’s problem, it is all of society’s responsibility to bring it to a decisive end.
ssw: njengoba ludlame lwetebulili luyinkhinga yemmango, kungumsebenti wemmango wonkhe kutsa tsa sincumo sekulucedza.

eng: bursary opportunities for young people kgaogelo letsebe sonia malinga (23) from piet retief in mpumalanga says being a shoprite group bursary recipient has ensured a promising future for her.
ssw: ematfuba emfundzate kubantfu labasha kgaogelo letsebe sonia malinga (23) wasepiet retief empumalanga utsi kutfola umfundzate lovela kushoprite group kucinisekise kutsi utawu ba nelikusasa lelitsembi sako.

eng: malinga received the bursary from the south african retailer in 2018. she applied for the bursary after finishing high school at hoërskool piet retief.
ssw: malinga utfole lomfu ndzate kulesitolo se kutsengisa saseningi zimu afrika ngemnyaka we2018.

eng: "growing up, i initially wanted to be a doctor, but later i started exploring other options.
ssw: "ngisakhula, ngacala ngafuna kuba ngudo kotela, kodvwa kamuva ngacala kubuka letinye tintfo.

eng: i read about supply chain and logistics management and was almost instantly attracted to it.
ssw: ngafundza ngete luchungechunge lokwe tfulwa kwetinsita kanye netekulawula kuhanjiswa kwemphahla futsi loku kwekugcina kwacishe kwangidvonsa ngaleso sikhatsi.

eng: i remember i used to sit and watch the trucks drive in and out of my hometown and wonder who was ensuring that the quality and quantity of goods were correct and that they arrived at the correct delivery point.
ssw: ngiyakhumbu la bengivamise kuhlala ngibuka emaloli angena futsi aphuma edolobheni langakitsi bese ngiyatibu ta kutsi ngubani locinise kisa kutsi letintfo letitfu tswako tisezingeni futsi tilinani lelifanele yini nekutsi ingabe tiyafika yini endzaweni lekufa nele tiye kuyo.

eng: that’s when i found my passion," says malinga.
ssw: kungaleso sikhatsi lapho ngacala kuba nelutsandvo lalo msebenti," kusho ma linga.

eng: malinga obtained a bcom honours degree in logistics management at the university of johannesburg and started her career with shoprite as a distribution centre trainee manager in february 2021. she was recently promoted to store replenishment analyst.
ssw: malinga watfola ticu tebcom honours kute kulawula kuhanjiswa kwemphahla enyuni vesi yasejohannesburg wabese ucala kusebenta eshoprite njengemphatsi wesikhungo losafundza abe aceceshwa ngendlo vana 2021. nyalo losesi usandza kukhushulelwa esikhundleni sekuba ngumhlatiyi weku gcwaliswa kabusha kwe mphahla.

eng: being part of the shoprite group has broadened malinga’s knowledge of the retail industry.
ssw: kuba yincenye yeshoprite group kukhulise lwati lamalinga kule mboni yetekutsengisa.

eng: "it has taught me even more about logistics management and enabled me to continuously develop my skills and advance in my career," she says.
ssw: "kungifundzisile kakhulu futsi nangalokungetiwe mayelana netekulawula kuhanjiswa kwemphahla nangekungenta kutsi ngichubeke nekutfu tfukisa emakhono ami nangekutsi ngikhule emsebentini wami," usho njalo losesi.

eng: how to applyapplications for the shoprite group’s allinclusive bursary programme are open for the 2023 academic year.
ssw: usifaka njani sicelo kufaka ticelo teluhlelo lwemfundzate lofaka konkhe weshoprite group kuvuliwe kumnya ka wekufundza we2023.

eng: the bursary ranges from r45 000 to r70 000 per annum, based on the field of study and institution.
ssw: lomfundzate ucala kur45 000 uye ku75 000 ngemnyaka, kuye ngemkhakha wekufundza nangaleso naleso sikhu ngo setemfundvo.

eng: it includes tuition fees, books, oncampus accommodation allowances and work back agreements.
ssw: ufaka ekhatsi imali yekufundza, yemabhuku, imali ye kuhlala kusikhungo lofundza kuso kanye ne tivumelwano tekusebenta kubo uma sewuphotfulile.

eng: new approach to fight corruption gets results vukuzenzele unnamed the fight against corruption requires both firm political will and independent, capable crimefighting institutions.
ssw: indlela lensha yekulwa nenkhohlakalo itfola imiphumela lemihle vukuzenzele unnmaed kulwa nenkhohlakalo kudzinga sandla setepolitiki lesicinile kanye netikhungo, letitimele, letikhonako kulwa nebugebengu.

eng: in my first state of the nation address, in 2018, i made a commitment to turn the tide against corruption in our public institutions and fight fraud and collusion in the private sector with the same intensity and purpose.
ssw: enkhulumeni yami yekucala yebunjalo belive, nga2018, ngenta sifungo sekutinikela kutsi ngigucule simo setenkhohlakalo eti khungweni tetfu ngiphi ndze futsi ngilwe neku khwabanisa nekubambisana ngenhloso lembi emkhakhe ni lotimele ngemandla ne nhloso lefananako.

eng: since then, we have been working hard to strengthen and support our law enforcement and related agencies.
ssw: kusukela ngaleso sikhatsi, siloku sisebenta ngeku tikhandla kute sicinise siphindze futsi sisekele emaejensi etfu nalaha mbisana nawo lacinisekisa kutfotjelwa kwemtsetfo.

eng: we set up the investigating directorate in the national prosecuting authority to deal with serious corruption and the special tribunal to enable the special investigating unit (siu) to more easily recover stolen funds.
ssw: sakhe luphiko lwete kuphenya kumtimba wavelonkhe wetekushu shisa kute kutsi libukane nenkhohlakalo lenemandla nekutsi inkantolo lekhetse kile yente luphiko lwete kuphenya lolukhetsekile (isiu) ikhone kuvumbulula kakhulu futsi kalula timali letintjontjiwe.

eng: we have also provided support and resources to other critical crimefighting bodies like the asset forfeiture unit, specialised commercial crimes unit and directorate for priority crime investigation, known as the hawks.
ssw: siphindze futsi sasita ngekwesekela nekunika imitfombolusito imitimba lebalulekile lelwa nebugebengu njengelu phiko lwekudla imphahla, luphiko lolukhetsekile lwetebugebengu beteku tsengisa kanye neluphiko lwekuphenya bugebengu lobuhamba embili, lolubitwa ngekutsi ngemahawks .

eng: these efforts are producing results.
ssw: lemitamo inemiphumela lemihle.

eng: through collaboration with key entities in the criminal justice system, the investigating directorate has enrolled over 20 corruption cases in the last financial year and 65 accused have been charged.
ssw: ngekusebentisana netinhlaka letibalulekile eluhlelweni lwetebulu ngiswa kutebugebengu, luphiko lwetekuphenya selubhalise emacala enkhohlakalo langetulu kwalange20 kulomnyakati mali lophelile kwaphindze futsi kwaboshwa basolwa labange65.

eng: these include several ‘state capture’ and other serious corruption cases.
ssw: loku kufaka ekhatsi emacala lamanyenti 'ekubanjwa kwembuso ngabhongwane' kanye nalamanye emacala enkho hlakalo lamatima.

eng: in the past financial year, the asset forfeiture unit obtained freezing orders to the value of r5.4 billion relating to corruption offences, with r70 million paid into the criminal assets recovery fund.
ssw: kulomnyakatimali lophe lile, luphiko lwekudla imphahla lwatfola imiyalelo yekuvala emaakhawunti lalinganiselwa kutigidzi gidzi letir5.4 letiphatselene nemacala enkhohlakalo, kwatsi tigidzi letinger70 tafakwa esikhwameni semphahla yebugebengu levunjululiwe.

eng: over the past eight years, the siu has recovered funds and assets to the value of r2.6 billion and set aside contracts to the value of r18 billion.
ssw: kuleminyaka lesipho hlongo leyendlulile, isiu ivumbulule timali nempha hla leyenta tigidzigidzi letir2.6 yaphindze futsi yancamula emakontileka lenta tigidzigidzi letir18.

eng: a total of 119 cases worth more than r13 billion have been enrolled by the siu at the special tribunal.
ssw: isiu seyibhalise enkantolo lekhetsekile linani lemacala la119 lenta ngetulu kweti gidzigidzi letir13.

eng: corruption is an extremely complex crime to prosecute.
ssw: inkhohlakalo licala lelima tima kakhulu kulishushisa.

eng: perpetrators go to extraordinary lengths to cover their tracks.
ssw: babhebhetseli batikha ndla ngalokukhetsekile ekuvaleni imikhondvo yabo.

eng: they set up shelf companies to hide dodgy transactions, rapidly moving monies between multiple accounts, misrepresenting income to the tax authorities, and, in the case of government employees, using friends and relatives to apply for tenders to mask their involvement.
ssw: bavula tinkampani letingasebenti tekutsi bafihle kuto imisebenti yabo lesolisako, njalonje bahambisa imali emkhatsini wemaakhawunti lama nyenti, betfule kubemtselo imalingena lengasiyo, futsi, basebenti bahulumende, basebentisa bangani nema lunga emndeni kutsi bafake ticelo temathenda kute kutsi bafihle kubandzakanyeka kwabo.

eng: this means that the response of the authorities has to be just as sophisticated.
ssw: lokuke kusho kutsi kuphendvula kwetiphatsi mandla nako kufanele kutsi kube ngulokushubile.

eng: in 2020, we established a multidisciplinary fusion centre as an operational hub to address priority financial crimes, including corruption.
ssw: nga2020, sasungula sikhungo ifusion centre lesimkhakhaminyenti saba sikhungo sekusebentela kute kutsi kubukwane nemacala ebugebengu lahamba embili, kufaka ekhatsi inkhohlakalo.

eng: the centre brings together the investigative capabilities of government’s crime prevention and security structures and those of the financial intelligence centre, which develops intelligence for law enforcement agencies to use in their investigations.
ssw: lesikhungo sihlanganisa emakhono ekuphenya etinhlaka tahulumende tekuvimbela bugebengu kanye netekuphepha kanye nalawo esikhungo sebunhloli kutetimali, lesi tfutfukisa tebunhloli kute kutsi tikhungo temtsetfo tiyisebentise eluphenyweni lwato.

eng: two years since the fusion centre was established, its multidisciplinary approach to ‘follow the money’ has yielded significant results.
ssw: eminyakeni lemibili kusukela kwasungulwa ifusion centre , indlela yaso lemkhakhaminyenti ‘yekulandzela imali’ ibe nemiphumela lemihle lemikhulu kakhulu.

eng: in the last financial year, the work of the fusion centre supported 276 fraud and corruption investigations.
ssw: kulomnyakatimali lophe lile, umsebenti wefusion centre usekele luphenyo lwenkhohlakalo neku khwabanisa lolunge276.

eng: approximately r659 million was restored to the state through preservation and recovery of the proceeds of crime.
ssw: tigidzi letilinganiselwa kuletinger659 tabuyi selwa kuhulumende ngekusebentisa kulondvo lota nekuvumbulula inzuzo yebugebengu.

eng: approximately r613 million in suspected criminal proceeds were frozen.
ssw: kulinganiselwa kutigidzi letinger613 letavalwa lekusolwa kutsi tinzuzo tebugebengu.

eng: the fusion centre was initially set up to investigate corruption around covidrelated procurement.
ssw: ifusion centre ekucaleni kwayo yasungulelwa kuphenya inkhohlakalo lephatselene nekutsengwa kwetintfo tecovid19 .

eng: its mandate is now being expanded to include moneylaundering, fraud, maladministration, terrorist financing and other serious financial crimes.
ssw: manje umsebenti wayo sewukhulisiwe kute kutsi ufake ekhatsi kuphenya kushushunjiswa kwemali, kukhwabanisa, kulawula budlabha, kwesekela nge timali emaphekula kanye nalamanye emacala ebuge bengu labucayi.

eng: the hawks recently outlined some of the progress that has been made by the anticorruption task team, of which the fusion centre forms part.
ssw: emahawks asandza kwendlala letinye tinchube kelembili letentiwe licembu lelilwa nenkhohlakalo, ifusion centre lebe yincenye yako.

eng: between the 2019 and 2022 financial years, 554 suspects were arrested for corruption, of which 142 were convicted.
ssw: emkhatsini wemnya katimali wanga2019 nanga2022, kuboshwe basolwa labange554 baboshelwa inkhohlakalo, kwatsi laba142 babo balahlwa licala.

eng: another vital financial intelligence tool is the lifestyle audits conducted by the south african revenue service (sars).
ssw: lelinye lithulusi lebunhloli lelibalulekile kulucwa ningo lwendlela yekuphila lolwentiwe luphiko lwe kugcogcwa kwemtselo lwaseningizimu (yisars).

eng: last year, sars completed 25 lifestyle audits to the value of over r450 million to resolve discrepancies between declared income and an individual’s lifestyle.
ssw: kulomnyaka lophelile, isars iphotfule lucwa ningo lwendlela yekuphila lolunge25 lolowenta tigidzi letinger450 kusombulula emagebe emkhatsini wemali lengenako ledzalulwako nendlela yekuphila yemuntfu.

eng: it is clear that the measures we have taken as this administration to restore the capacity, capability and credibility of the institutions involved in the fight against corruption are having a demonstrable impact.
ssw: kuyacaca kutsi letinyatselo letitsetfwe ngulolulawulo kubuyisela emandla, likhono nekuncomeka kwetikhungo letilwa nekhohlakalo tinemphu mela lobonakalako lomuhle kakhulu.

eng: the synchronised work of all the law enforcement agencies is hitting criminals where it hurts most: in their pockets.
ssw: lomsebenti lohlanga nisiwe wawo onkhe lamaejensi lacinisekisa kutfotjelwa kwemtsetfo ubamba tigebengu lapho titincane ngakhona: emakhikhini ato.

eng: public funds that were looted and diverted are being recovered and those responsible for these acts are being prosecuted by our courts.
ssw: timali tahulumende letaphangwa tabese tihanjiswa ngaletinye tindlela tiyavunjululwa kantsi futsi labo labatsintse kako mayelana naleto tento bashushiswa tinkantolo.

eng: look out for early signs of childhood cancer more matshediso a lack of awareness of childhood cancer and its symptoms means that many south african children are diagnosed when the disease is at an advanced stage.
ssw: caphela timphawu letisheshe tivele tamdlavuta wasebuntfwaneni more matshediso kungacapheli mdlavuta wase buntfwaneni kanye netinkhomba tawo kusho kutsi bantfwana labanyenti baseningizimu afrika ngesikhatsi batfolakala kutsi banalesifo sisuke sesisezi ngeni leliphakeme.

eng: the earlier cancer is diagnosed and treated, the higher the chance of a full recovery.
ssw: uma ngabe mdlavuta usheshe watfolakala wabese uyelashwa, ematfuba ekwelulama ngalokuphelele abasetulu.

eng: childhood cancer foundation south africa (choc) communication coordinator taryn seegers says by knowing the common signs of cancer in young people, you could help save a life.
ssw: umchumanisi wenhlangano yaseningi zimu afrika yamdlavuta wasebuntfwaneni (ichoc) taryn seegers utsi ngekwati timphawu tamdlavuta kubantfu labancane, unga sita usindzise imphilo.

eng: "the signs and symptoms can be difficult to spot amid the normal bumps, bruises, growth spurts and mood swings.
ssw: "timphawu netinkhomba kungaba matima kutibona emkhatsini wemaguludla, imitfubulela, timila kanye nekuntjintjantjintja kwemiva.

eng: however, early detection is key," she says.
ssw: nanoma kunjalo, kutfolakala kwato kubalule kile kakhulu," kusho yena.

eng: according to the cancer association of south africa (cansa), between 800 to 1 000 south african children are diagnosed with cancer each year.
ssw: ngekuya kwenhlangano yaseningizimu afrika yetamdlavuta (icansa), njalo ngemnyaka bantfwana baseningizimu afrika labatfolakala banamdla vuta basemkhatsini walabange800 kuya kulaba 1 000. nanoma kunjalo, lenhlangano ilinganisela ekutsini ihhafu yalaba ntfwana eningizimu afrika abatfolwa.

eng: however, the association estimates that half of the children with cancer in south africa are never diagnosed.
ssw: kwenta siciniseko sekutsi mdlavuta ubonwa masinyane, ichoc yenta tinhlelo tekucaphelisa emimangweni, itjela batali nebantfwana ngetimphawu letisheshe tibekhona teku caphelisa labafanele kutsi baticaphele.

eng: to help ensure cancer is spotted as soon as possible, choc runs awareness programmes in communities, telling parents and children about the early warning signs they must look out for.
ssw: lenhlangano yesekela bantfwana nebantfu labasha labanamdlavuta noma tifo tengati letisongela imphilo kanye nemindeni yabo.

eng: "we aim to improve early detection and facilitate effective treatment.
ssw: "sihlose kusheshe sisi bone lesifo bese siselapha ngemphumelelo.

eng: at any one time, choc can have over 1 500 children and teenagers in its care, while offering psychosocial support to over 1 500 families," says seegers.
ssw: nanoma ngunini, ichoc ingana kekela bantfwana nebantfu labasha labangetulu kwalaba1 500, ibe futsi yesekela ngekwetengcondvo nangekwetenhlalo imindeni lengetulu kwale1 500," kusho seegers.

eng: in the past financial year, seegers says choc was able to serve 1 724 children, 553 teenagers and 2 232 adults through its core programmes.
ssw: kulomnyakatimali lophe lile, seegers utsi ichoc yakhona kutfula tinsita kubantfwana laba1 724, bantfu labasha laba553 kanye nebantfu labadzala laba2 232 ngetinhlelo tayo letingumgogodla.

eng: "our services include emotional support through their cancer journey, comfort, endoflife care and bereavement support," says seegers.
ssw: "tinsita tetfu tifaka ekhatsi kwesekelwa ngekwemiva ngesikhatsi basesebukene namdlavuta, kudvudvutwa, kunakekelwa kwaseku pheleni kwemphilo kanye nekwesekelwa uma sewu shonelwe," kusho seegers.

eng: st siluan’s signs of childhood cancer s – seek medical help early for ongoing symptoms.
ssw: timphawu tast siluan tamdlavuta wasebuntfwaneni s – funa lusito lwetekwe lashwa kusenesikhatsi lwetinkhomba letichube kako.

eng: i – white spot in the eye, new squint, sudden blindness or bulging eyeball.
ssw: i – licashata lelimhlo phe esweni, kufica liso lokusha, kungaboni emehlweni lokuvelenje kwenteke ngekushesha noma kukhukhumuka kwendvumbu yeliso.

eng: l – lump on the stomach, pelvis, head, arms, legs, testicle or glands.
ssw: l – sigadla esiswini, engculwini, enhloko, emkhonweni, emile nteni, emasendzeni noma emandlaleni.

eng: u – unexplained fever present for over two weeks, weight loss, fatigue, pale appearance, easy bruising and bleeding.
ssw: u – imfimva lengatiwa kutsi ibangwa yini lebambana ngetulu kwemaviki lamabili, kwehla kwesisindvo semtimba, kudzinwa, kubukeka uphaphatse kile, kutfola imitfubulela kalula kanye nekopha.

eng: a – aching bones, joints, back and easy fractures.
ssw: a – kubabuhlungu kwematsambo, kwe malunga, kwemgogodla kanye nekwephuka kalula.

eng: n – neurological signs, a change in walking, balance or speech, continuous headaches with/without vomiting and an enlarged head.
ssw: n – timphawu teku ngalungi kwemgogodla nalokuphatselene nawo, kugucuka kwendle la lohamba ngayo, kwekusimama noma kwenkhulumo, inhloko lengapheli lehambisana nekuhlanta noma lenga hambisani nekuhlanta kanye nekukhula kwenhloko.

eng: the n3 upgrade is empowering south africans owen mngadi mduduzi jijana is the owner of the disability empowerment movement, which is one of the companies that is currently benefiting from the r26 billion upgrade of the n3 highway between pietermaritzburg and durban in kwazulunatal.
ssw: kutfutfukiswa kwen3 kutfutfukisa bantfu baseningizimu afrika owen mngadi mduduzi jijana longumnikati wenhlangano letfutfukisa labaphila nekukhubateka, lekungulenye yetinkapani letizuzako nyalo kula mabhiliyoni lar26 ekutfutfukisa umgwaco lomkhulu in3 emkhatsini kwemgungundlovu nasethekwini kwazulunatali.

eng: the project, which is being spearheaded by the south african national roads agency soc limited (sanral), is ensuring that entrepreneurs such as jijana not only benefit but in turn create employment for others.
ssw: lomklamo, loholwa yisouth afri can national road agency soc limited (isanral), icinisekisa kutsi bosomabhizinisi labafana najijana abagcini kuphela ngekuzuza kodvwa baphindze bavulele labanye ematfuba emsebenti.

eng: jijana, who lives with a disability, says his company installs road signs between hilton and pietermaritzburg.
ssw: jijana, lophila nekukhubateka, utsi inkapani yakhe isebenta kufaka timphawu temgwaco emkhatsini kwasehilton nasemgungundlovu.

eng: he employs 13 people and says the project has changed their lives.
ssw: ucashe bantfu laba13 futsi utsi lomklamo sewutiguculile timpilo tabo.

eng: "as people living with a disability, we have shown that we are capable.
ssw: "njengebantfu lesiphila nekukhubateka, sikhombisile kutsi natsi sinelikhono.

eng: we no longer rely on grants.
ssw: asikanciki kuphela kumali yesondlo sahulumende.

eng: we do the actual work," says jijana.
ssw: senta umsebenti wangemphela," kusho jijana.

eng: sanral n3 programme manager tsepo matekane says his company ensured that 30% of the work was assigned to local companies with the ability to provide various services.
ssw: umphatsi waloluhlelo lwesanral n3 tshepo matekane utsi inkapani yakhe icinisekisile kutsi umse benti lo30% waniketwa tinkapani tendzawo letinelikhono lekwenta imisebenti letitsite.

eng: this created many opportunities for small businesses owned by youth, previously disadvantaged people and women.
ssw: loku kwavula ematfuba lamanengi kumabhizinisi lamancane laphetfwe lusha, bantfu lebebacindzetelekile kanye nabomake.

eng: "there are 108 small, medium and micro enterprises currently working on the various projects," he says.
ssw: "kunemabhizinisi la108 lamancane, lasemkhatsini nalasafufusa kungunyalo lasebenta kumiklamo lehlukahlukene," usho njalo.

eng: nokuthula zondi of ingqalabutho yamalinda multipurpose trading was awarded a contract to supply soil and install water drainage pipes.
ssw: nokuthula zondi weingqalabutho yamalinda multipurpose trading waniketwa inkontileka yekuphakela umhlaba nekufaka emaphayiphi ekuhambisa emanti.

eng: she says her company employed eight skilled workers, including drivers.
ssw: utsi inkapani yakhe icashe bantfu laba8 labanemakhono, labafaka ekhatsi bashayeli.

eng: zondi adds that women are as capable as men and her company has a good service track record.
ssw: zondi ungete watsi bomake nabo banelikhono njengabo babe futsi inkapani yakhe inemlandvo lomuhle wekwenta umsebenti.

eng: "we understand the importance of time and meet all our targets to ensure the project runs accordingly.
ssw: "siyakuvisisa lokubaluleka kwesikhatsi nekugcina sikhatsi lesibekiwe kute sicinisekise kutsi umklamo uhamba kahle ngalokufanelekile.

eng: we appreciate the opportunity and we hope more will come so that our company can grow according to construction levels," she adds.
ssw: sibonga kutfola lelitfuba futsi sitsemba kutsi kukhulu lesitakutfola kute sikhulise inkapani yetfu ihambi sane nemazinga etekwakha," wangeta ngekusho njalo lomake.

eng: national government’s key projects matekane says the durbanfree stategauteng logistics and industrial corridor development has an estimated budget of r26 billion and is one of national government’s key strategic integrated projects.
ssw: imiklamo lemcoka yahu lumende wavelonkhe matekane utsi lomklamo wekutfutfu kisa lobitwa ngekutsi yidurbanfree state logistics and industrial corridor unesilinganiso sesabelotimali lesitigidzigidzi ler26 futsi ungu lomunye wemiklamo lomcoka wendlelalisu lehlangene yahulu mende wavelonkhe.

eng: it is known as sip2.
ssw: watiwa ngekutsi yisip2.

eng: the project will widen the n3 with more lanes in each direction.
ssw: lo mklamo utawuvula umgwaco in3 kutsi ube naleminye imizila eluhlangotsini ngalunye.

eng: it also includes changing some of the major interchanges to improve traffic flow.
ssw: uphindze umbandzakanye kuguculwa kwe kuchumana kwemigwaco lemikhulu kute kutfutfukiswe kuhamba kahle kwetigitjelwa nangekukhululeka.

eng: the affected section of the n3 has over the years experienced traffic congestion, particularly during peak hours because the majority of cargo trucks from the durban harbour use the highway to gauteng and other inland provinces.
ssw: sigaba lesitsintsekako semgwaco in3 kuleminyaka leyengcile besine kumphintjana kwetigitjelwa, kakhulu ngetikhatsi letiphitsitelako ngoba linyenti letitfutsi temitfwalo lemikhulu letichamuka elugwini lasethekwini tisebentisa lomgwaco kuya egauteng nakuletinye tifundza letisemkhatsini kwalelive.

eng: some of the cargo truck drivers have caused accidents by not taking care on sharp curves.
ssw: futsi bekuba netingoti temgwaco letinengi letibangwa bashayeli betitfutsi temtfwalo ngenca yekunganakekeli uma bahamba lapho kune majika lamakhulu.

eng: "apart from resolving chronic traffic by creating greater mobility through the construction of additional traffic lanes, the upgrading of the n3 will result in increased safety.
ssw: "akusiko kuphela kugcwala kwetitfutsi kwamalanga onkhe lokwenta kutsi tigitjelwa tihambe kahle lokusunjululiwe nga lokwakha imizila lengetiwe, kutfutfukiswa kwen3 kutawenta kutsi kwenyuke tekuphepha.

eng: dangerous curves will be ironed out.
ssw: emajika lama khulu lasabekako atawu suswa.

eng: unsafe intersections will be redesigned," maketane says.
ssw: timphambano mgwaco letingakaphephi titawuhlelwa kabusha," kusho matekane.

eng: sanral awarded three contracts in the last quarter of 2021, and construction work began between january and april.
ssw: isanral inikete tinkhontileka letintsatfu kulekota leyengcile yemnyaka we2021 umsebenti wacala kwentiwa emkhatsini kwabhimbi dvwane namabasa.

eng: the sections currently being upgraded are the 19 kilometre (km) stretch from cato ridge to dardanelles, commonly known as umlaas road; the 26.6 km section from the dardanelles interchange to lynnfield park; and the 30 km stretch from lynnfield park to the ashburton interchange.
ssw: tincenye letitfutfukiswako nyalo sigaba semgwaco lomakhi lomitha (km) la19 losuka ecato ridge ufike edarda nelles, lowatiwa ngekutsi ngumgwaco iumlaas; sigaba semgwaco lesi20.6 km losuka edardanelles inter change kuya elynnfield park; kanye nesigaba semgwaco lesi30km losuka elynnfield park uye eashburton inter change.

eng: matekane explains that sip2 will strengthen the logistics and transport corridor between south africa’s main industrial hubs, improve access to durban’s export and import facilities and raise efficiency along the corridor.
ssw: matekane utsi isip2 itawukhulisa lomgwaco weti gitjelwa newetekutfutswa kwemphahla losemkhatsini kwemahabhu etimboni la mcoka aseningizimu afrika, itawutfutfukisa kufinyelela kutinsita tekuhanjiswa nekunge niswa kwemphahla letisethekwini futsi itawu khuphula lizinga lekusebenta ngendlela lekahle kule phaseji.

eng: he adds that the project is part of the national development plan 2030 and national transport master plan 2050 and supports government’s economic reconstruction and recovery plan.
ssw: ungete ngekutsi lomklamo uyincenye yeluhlelo lwavelonkhe lwentfu tfuko lwemnyaka we2030 neluhlelo lolukhulu letekutfutsa lwemnyaka we2050 futsi usekela luhlelo lwahulumende lwekwakha kabusha nele kuvuselela umnotfo.

eng: to this end, government intends to develop a transport system that is consistent with the real needs of the people living in south africa and caters for people with less money to spend on travel.
ssw: kute kube ngunyalo, hulumende uhlose kutfu tfukisa luhlelo lwetekutfutsa lolutawuhambisana neti dzinga tangemphela tebantfu labahlala eni ngizimu afrika futsi lutawu bonelela bantfu labanemali lencane lebayisebentisela kukhokhela tindleko teku hamba.

eng: maketane says the upgrades will take between eight and 10 years to complete and road closures will be kept to the minimum.
ssw: matekane utsi lokutfu tfukiswa kwalomgwaco kutawutsatsa iminyaka lesemkhatsini kwesi phohlongo ne10 kodvwa kuvalwa kwemigwaco kutawugcinwa kusezingeni leliphasi.

eng: alcohol may damage your unborn baby’s health vukuzenzele unnamed pregnant women have the responsibility to not drink because alcohol can cause a condition that affects a baby’s development.
ssw: tjwala bungalimata imphilo yemntfwana wakho asengakatalwa vukuzenzele unnamed bomake labakhulelwe banemsebenti weku tivikela banganatsi tjwala ngoba bungabanga sifo lesitsikameta kukhula kwemntfwana.

eng: this is according to the deputy minister of social development, hendrietta bogopanezulu, who recently launched the 999 foetal alcohol spectrum disorder (fasd) advocacy programme.
ssw: loku kushiwo lisekela lendvuna yetekufutfukisa tenhlalo, hendrietta bogo panezulu, losandza kucala luhlelo lwekulwa nesifo i999 foetal alcohol spectrum disorder (ifasd).

eng: the aim of the initiative is to encourage communities to help protect unborn babies by educating people, especially women of childbearing age, about the dangers of drinking alcohol while pregnant or breastfeeding.
ssw: inhloso yalomkhankhaso kugcugcutela imimango kutsi isite kuvikela bantfwana lebasengakabelekwa ngekufundzisa bantfu, kakhulu bomake labasakhona kubeleka, mayelana nebu ngoti bekunatsa tjwala ube ukhulelwe noma usamu nyisa.

eng: "it is important for all women who are pregnant and those who wish to give birth to healthy babies to avoid alcohol.
ssw: "kumcoka kutsi bonkhe bomake labakhulelwe nalabo labanesifiso sekutala bantfwana labaphile kahle bayekele kunatsa tjwala.

eng: the damage caused by fasd is permanent and irreversible, and children born with this condition have physical and intellectual problems," said deputy minister bogopanezulu at the launch.
ssw: umonakalo lobangwa yifasd uba wemphilo yonkhe futsi awubuyiseleki emuva, futsi bantfwana labatalwa nalokugula baba netinkinga tasemtimbeni netasengco ndvweni," kwasho lisekela lendvuna bogopanezulu emcimbini wekwetfulwa kwaloluhlelo.

eng: she added that south africa is known to have a drinking problem, with the country ranking among the worst in the world for its levels of alcohol consumption.
ssw: wangeta ngekutsi iningi zimu afrika yatiwa ngekuba nenkinga yekunatsa tjwala, lelive libalwa njengalamanye lamabi lahamba embili emhlabeni ngenca yemazinga alo ekunatsa tjwala.

eng: deputy minister bogopanezulu recently visited different parts of the country, educating women about the dangers of drinking alcohol while pregnant as part of the 999 fasd campaign.
ssw: lisekela lendvuna bogopanezulu usandza kuhambela tincenye letehlukahlukene talelive letfu, afundzisa bomake mayelana nebungoti bekunatsa tjwala bakhulelwe njengencenye yemkhankaso we999 fasd.

eng: when she was in boitekong in rustenburg in the north west, she told residents that the levels of alcohol abuse in the township are alarming.
ssw: lesikhatsi aseboitekong erustenburg enyakatfo nshonalanga, watjela takhamuti kutsi lizinga leku setjentiswa kabi kwetjwala emalokishini liyesabeka.

eng: a fourmonth pregnant woman and resident of boitekong, basetsana tlalang (28), who attended one of the campaigns, said she stopped drinking alcohol entirely after learning she was pregnant and said she is attending antenatal and information sessions at the clinic.
ssw: make lonetinyanga letine akhulelwe lohlala eboite kong, basetsane tlalang (28), lobekahambele lomunye walemikhankaso, utse wayekela futsi wagcina ngci kunatsa emva kwekutfola kutsi ukhulelwe futsi watsi sewuhambela emaseshini asemtfolamphilo elwatiso newesikhatsi lesandvulela kubeleka.

eng: she urged other pregnant women to immediately stop drinking alcohol and doing drugs.
ssw: uncusa labanye bomake labakhulelwe kutsi bayekele leso sikhatsi kunatsa tjwala nekusebentisa tidzakwamiva.

eng: the struggle to give south africa a more human face vukuzenzele unnamed on 12 september 1977, stephen bantu biko died in police custody in pretoria central prison.
ssw: umshikashika wekubuyisa ubuntfu eningizimu afrika vukuzenzele unnamed mhla ti12 inyoni 1977, ste phen bantfu biko washona agcinwe maphoyisa ejele lelatiwa ngepretoria central prison.

eng: human dignity, the principle at the heart of his black consciousness activism, was denied to him.
ssw: sitfunti sebuntfu, leku simiso lesihamba embili kulobushoshovu bakhe bekubuyisa sitfunti semuntfu lomnyama, sacekelwa phasi.

eng: in the words of the family lawyer sir sydney kentridge, his was "a miserable and lonely death on a mat on a stone floor in a prison cell".
ssw: ngekwemagama emmeli wemndeni wakhe sir sydney kentridge, "kushona kwakhe bekubuhlungu kakhulu futsi bekayedvwa ashonela emethini lephasi esemendeni yelijele."

eng: it remains a source of great sorrow all these years later to recall that steve biko was just 30 years old when he died.
ssw: kutawuhlala kuyintfo lebanga lusizi lolukhulu emva kwayo yonkhe leminyaka leyengcile, kukhumbula kutsi steve biko bakaneminyaka le30 kuphela uma ashona.

eng: he was cut down in his prime by those who feared the power and resonance of his ideas of selfliberation and his efforts to infuse black men and women with pride and dignity.
ssw: wabulawa asengakafiki esicongweni semphilo yakhe ngilabo bebasaba emandla ekubona imibono yakhe lesetulu yekutikhulula kanye nemitamo yekufaka kumuntfu lomnyama kutitsandza nekuba nesitfunti emadvodzeni nakubomake besive lesinsundvu.

eng: he never got to see in his lifetime what he called ‘the glittering prize’, the realisation of a true humanity.
ssw: azange akhone kubona ekuphileni kwakhe loko lokubitwa ngekutsi ‘ngumklomelo lokhatimu lako", lekukubona buntfu bangemphela.

eng: writing about this ideal, he famously said: "in time we shall be in a position to bestow upon south africa the greatest gift possible – a more human face.
ssw: abhala ngalomcondvo, kwadvuma kutsi watsi: "ngekuhamba kwesikhatsi sitawukhona kupha iningizimu afrika sipho lesikhulu kunato tonkhe – kukhulisa sitfunti sebuntfu."

eng: "when we won our freedom in 1994, we understood that the right to vote was just one part of our struggle for human dignity.
ssw: uma sincoba sitfola inkhu luleko yetfu ngemnyaka we1994, besivisisa kutsi lilungelo lekuvota liyincenye leyodvwa yemzabalazo wetfu wekutfola sitfunti sebuntfu.

eng: twentyeight years into our democracy, we are confronted with many challenges, such as poverty, unemployment and inequality.
ssw: eminyakeni lemashumi lamabili nesiphohlongo singene kuntsandvoye linyenti, sihlangabetene netinseyeya letinyenti, letifana nebuphuya, kuswelakala kwemisebenti nekungalingani.

eng: as a result, we often lose sight of how far we have come in giving effect to the principles on which our constitution is founded and that anchored steve biko’s thought and teachings.
ssw: ngenca yaloko, sivamise kunga boni kutsi sisuka khashane kanganani kute sikhone kufeza timiso letisisekelo semtsetfosisekelo wetfu futsi letichumanisa imicondvo netifundziso tasteve biko.

eng: in 1977 a heartless regime killed one of our country’s most promising leaders by depriving him of the food, water and medical treatment he urgently needed as a result of brutal beatings by the apartheid police.
ssw: ngemnyaka we1997, umbuso lobewungenalu velo wabulala lomunye umholi walelive lakitsi lobekatse mbisa kakhulu ngekumncisha kudla, emanti kanye nekwelashwa lobe kakudzinga kakhulu ngenca yekushaywa kabuhlungu ngemaphoyisa elubandlu lulo.

eng: twenty years later, in a 1997 judgment, the constitutional court said that fulfilling the fundamental rights of every citizen and striving to achieve their socioeconomic rights is the hallmark of a democratic society aiming to salvage lost dignity.
ssw: emva kweminyaka lemashumi lamabili, sincumo senkantolo semnyaka we1997, inkantolo yemtsetfosisekelo yatsi kuphumelelisa emalungelo lasisekelo awo wonkhe umuntfu nekutfola ema lungelo abo etemnotfo kuluphawu lwemmango wentsandvoyelinyenti loluhlose kubuyisela sitfunti lesilahlekile.

eng: in south africa today, we continue to work to fulfil the basic rights of every south african so that they may lead quality lives free of disease, hunger and deprivation.
ssw: namuhla eningizimu afrika, siyachubeka kuse bentela kuphumelelisa emalungelo lasisekelo awo wonkhe umuntfu waseningizimu afrika kute baphile imphilo lesezingeni lenge nato tifo, indlala nekuswela.

eng: successive democratic administrations have implemented policies to salvage the lost dignity of this country’s majority by providing education, health care, housing and basic services.
ssw: imibuso yentsandvoye linyenti lelandzelanako isebentise imitsetfomigomo leletsa sitfunti sebantfu balelive lebesilahlekile ngekubanika imfundvo, kunakekelwa kwetemphilo, tindlu kanye netinsita letisi sekelo.

eng: in south africa today, a decent education is a fundamental right.
ssw: namuhla eningizimu afrika, kutfola imfundvo lesezingeni kulilungelo lelisisekelo.

eng: the state invests in early childhood development, in supporting learning outcomes for our youngest citizens, and provides social relief through school feeding programmes to ensure young learners achieve the best outcomes possible.
ssw: hulumende utjale timali kumfundvo legcile ekukhuliseni kahle bantfwana, ekusekeleni imiphumela yetifundvo ebantfwaneni balelive lakitsi labasesebancane, futsi kusita ummango ngeluhlelo leku phakela bantfwana kudla etikolweni kucinisekisa kutsi bafundzi labasesebancane batfola imiphumela lesetulu.

eng: through the national student financial aid scheme and various other forms of state support, thousands of young south africans from poor backgrounds have been able to become doctors, lawyers, teachers, scientists, artisans and entrepreneurs.
ssw: ngalesikimu savelonkhe selusito lwetimali kuba fundzi nangaletinye tinhlobo telusito lwahulumende, tinkhulungwane tebantfu labasha baseningizimu afrika labavela eminde nini lephuyile bakhonile kuba bodokotela, bammeli, bothishela, bososayensi, emaathizeni nabosomabhi zinisi.

eng: government supports poor and vulnerable citizens through an extensive social safety net and provides work opportunities through mass public employment programmes.
ssw: hulumende usekela takhamuti letibutsakatsaka ngekusebentisa tinhlelo tekusita emakhaya laphuyile futsi iniketa ematfuba emisebenti ngaletinhlelo tahulumende tekucasha bantfu labanengi.

eng: in the repressive south africa in which steve biko died, freedom of speech was curtailed and political activism attracted detention or worse.
ssw: kuleningizimu afrika lebeyicindzetela leyabulala steve biko, bekute kukhu luma ngekukhululeka kantsi kuba sishoshovi kutepolitiki bekuholela ekutseni uboshwe ngaphandle kwekushushiswa noma ubulawe.

eng: in south africa today, young people of the same age as steve biko was and even younger are at the forefront of activism for causes closest to them, and they are able to organise free of harassment or banishment.
ssw: namuhla eningizimu afrika, bantfu labasha labaneminyaka lelingana naleyo bekanayo steve biko noma lemincane kunaleyo bahamba embili kutebu shoshovi betintfo leti sedvute nabo, futsi bayakhona kutihlela kahle ngekukhululeka ngaphandle kwekuhlukunyetwa noma kwekudzingiswa.
